Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
At Antora, we’re on a mission to stop climate change. And we can’t do that unless we tackle the 30% of global emissions that come from industry.

Antora is unlocking zero-emissions industrial energy, cheaper than fossil fuels. Antora’s thermal batteries store energy from renewables as heat for days on end, delivering that stored energy as heat and power at the scale and temperatures that large industrial operations demand. We’re on a path to eliminate gigatons of emissions while strengthening domestic manufacturing, curbing industrial air pollution, and enhancing America’s clean energy leadership.

We are growing our company with people who put team and mission first, value connection through laughter and joy, and build with humility and openness. We are committed to continue building a diverse, passionate, and creative team dedicated to a future where every industrial facility, everywhere on earth, is powered by abundant, low-cost, zero-emissions energy.

Position Summary

We are looking for an Energy Markets Data Analyst who understands energy systems and is adept at using sophisticated software tools to gain a comprehensive understanding of complex data. In this role, you will serve as a key member of Antora’s analytics team in deriving insights from diverse data sets, enhancing our understanding of energy market dynamics, trends in industrial decarbonization, and battery operation strategies.

Roles & Responsibilities


Utilize our Python-based optimization software to support strategic corporate decisions regarding battery operations.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our internal Geographic Information Systems (GIS) platform to analyze the geographical dimensions of industrial energy dynamics.
Utilize Excel to conduct high-level financial analysis of project financing and energy market dynamics.
Support ad hoc analysis of various data to support product, market, and strategic decision making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect data and insights, ensuring alignment with current market conditions and strategic objectives.
Support Antora’s Project Development team by conducting analyses and building tools which identify, screen, prioritize, and evaluate the economics/impact of project opportunities.
Prepare and present reports and presentations for customers, investors, and Antora senior management, delivering actionable insights that influence key decisions.
Manage engagements with energy markets consultants to support project financing transactions.



Key Qualifications


Passion for solving climate change
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field with a focus on energy markets.
2-3 years of experience in an analytical role, preferably within the energy sector.
Proficient in multi-disciplinary analysis with the ability to adapt to various domains and toolsets.
Skilled in Python programming, particularly for data analysis and model development.
Familiar with interacting with Snowflake or other SQL-based data warehouses or data lakes.
Experience with ArcGIS or similar geographic information system platforms.
Proficient in Excel for basic financial and data analysis.
Demonstrated ability to create professional and visually appealing PowerPoint presentations.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills.
Deep intellectual curiosity and strong work ethic.
Ability to work independently and excel in an unstructured environment.



Additional Qualifications Desired


Experience in finance or consulting fields
Experience with CPLEX or similar software for linear optimization
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or Keras.
Experience forecasting time-series data utilizing statistical or ML frameworks
Exposure to a formal software development environment as a developer



Work Location: Onsite - San Jose, CA

Salary Range: $96,000 USD - $115,000 USD

Salary Basis: Annual

This job posting contains the salary range that Antora Energy believes it would be willing to pay for the posted job. The actual salary offered will be determined within the posted range based on a candidate's experience, credentials, and expertise as they pertain to the requirements of the position.

In addition to a competitive base salary, Antora Energy’s Total Rewards program includes a premium health benefits package with life and disability insurance, a 401K plan, a flexible spending account, industry leading paid time off policy, providing a flexible and inclusive holiday observance, as well as paid volunteer time off.

We are excited to share our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace.


Show more
HTML:
At Antora, we’re on a mission to stop climate change. And we can’t do that unless we tackle the 30% of global emissions that come from industry.

Antora is unlocking zero-emissions industrial energy, cheaper than fossil fuels. Antora’s thermal batteries store energy from renewables as heat for days on end, delivering that stored energy as heat and power at the scale and temperatures that large industrial operations demand. We’re on a path to eliminate gigatons of emissions while strengthening domestic manufacturing, curbing industrial air pollution, and enhancing America’s clean energy leadership.

We are growing our company with people who put team and mission first, value connection through laughter and joy, and build with humility and openness. We are committed to continue building a diverse, passionate, and creative team dedicated to a future where every industrial facility, everywhere on earth, is powered by abundant, low-cost, zero-emissions energy.

Position Summary

We are looking for an Energy Markets Data Analyst who understands energy systems and is adept at using sophisticated software tools to gain a comprehensive understanding of complex data. In this role, you will serve as a key member of Antora’s analytics team in deriving insights from diverse data sets, enhancing our understanding of energy market dynamics, trends in industrial decarbonization, and battery operation strategies.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Utilize our Python-based optimization software to support strategic corporate decisions regarding battery operations.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of our internal Geographic Information Systems (GIS) platform to analyze the geographical dimensions of industrial energy dynamics.
  • Utilize Excel to conduct high-level financial analysis of project financing and energy market dynamics.
  • Support ad hoc analysis of various data to support product, market, and strategic decision making.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect data and insights, ensuring alignment with current market conditions and strategic objectives.
  • Support Antora’s Project Development team by conducting analyses and building tools which identify, screen, prioritize, and evaluate the economics/impact of project opportunities.
  • Prepare and present reports and presentations for customers, investors, and Antora senior management, delivering actionable insights that influence key decisions.
  • Manage engagements with energy markets consultants to support project financing transactions.


Key Qualifications

  • Passion for solving climate change
  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field with a focus on energy markets.
  • 2-3 years of experience in an analytical role, preferably within the energy sector.
  • Proficient in multi-disciplinary analysis with the ability to adapt to various domains and toolsets.
  • Skilled in Python programming, particularly for data analysis and model development.
  • Familiar with interacting with Snowflake or other SQL-based data warehouses or data lakes.
  • Experience with ArcGIS or similar geographic information system platforms.
  • Proficient in Excel for basic financial and data analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to create professional and visually appealing PowerPoint presentations.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills.
  • Deep intellectual curiosity and strong work ethic.
  • Ability to work independently and excel in an unstructured environment.


Additional Qualifications Desired

  • Experience in finance or consulting fields
  • Experience with CPLEX or similar software for linear optimization
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or Keras.
  • Experience forecasting time-series data utilizing statistical or ML frameworks
  • Exposure to a formal software development environment as a developer


Work Location: Onsite - San Jose, CA

Salary Range: $96,000 USD - $115,000 USD

Salary Basis: Annual

This job posting contains the salary range that Antora Energy believes it would be willing to pay for the posted job. The actual salary offered will be determined within the posted range based on a candidate's experience, credentials, and expertise as they pertain to the requirements of the position.

In addition to a competitive base salary, Antora Energy’s Total Rewards program includes a premium health benefits package with life and disability insurance, a 401K plan, a flexible spending account, industry leading paid time off policy, providing a flexible and inclusive holiday observance, as well as paid volunteer time off.

We are excited to share our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace.

Title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will join a driven, collaborative team within an ambitious, entrepreneurial global organization. You will work collaboratively within the Data & Analytics team supporting internal reporting for Global Client Services. This role requires a proactive individual who takes ownership of all assigned work and thrives in a collaborative team environment.

We pride ourselves on being a positive work environment, and place value on a work/life balance. This means thoughtful, sustainable workloads, as well as professional development opportunities to help you reach your career goals.

We are currently hiring out of the following office location(s):


Cherry Hill, NJ
Downers Grove, IL


This role may be eligible for voluntary work-from-home consideration. In order to be considered for this position, you should live within a commutable distance to one of these office locations, even if you plan to request a work-from-home arrangement, as there may be times when in-person meetings, training sessions, social events, or similar activities are held onsite.

This key position reports to the Director, Source-to-Pay Data & Analytics within our Advisory team. We're a dedicated, down-to-earth group in a growing organization offering plenty of opportunity. We look forward to adding you into the mix!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will:


Handle diverse data inputs and transform them into valuable insights, demonstrating strong data organization and cleansing skills, ensuring that data is presented in a format that is clear and accessible to team members.
Utilize tools and techniques to clean and standardize data, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and identify key outcomes for reporting.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders (technical and non-technical) in clear and concise formats
Demonstrate exceptional communication skills, documenting and articulating findings and action items



Requirements

You'll need to have:


Bachelor's or Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Business Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience with business intelligence software such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal (English).
Knowledge in Programming Languages (SQL, Python) for querying and manipulating data stored in databases
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality reporting
A strong work ethic, self-motivation and progressive thinking, thriving on new challenges.
Ability to self-manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects.


(We want to make sure you're set up to succeed, and we view these as the critical skills you'll need to achieve great things at Corcentric!)

As we continue to grow our Advisory practice, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, we would like to communicate the following:


We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth minded
We prioritize both the process and outcome of work, demonstrating a strong commitment to the success of our customers and colleagues. Exceptional quality work is an essential standard for us.
We operate within a voluntary work-from-home framework, yet we uphold the same level of accountability and responsibility as in a traditional office setting



About Us

Corcentric is a global provider of business spend management and revenue management software and services for mid-market and Fortune 1000 businesses. Corcentric delivers software, advisory services, and payments focused on reducing costs, optimizing working capital, and unlocking revenue.

We achieve success by exemplifying our core values in the way we work, communicate, and collaborate:


Do the Right Thing
Embrace + Drive Change
Be Empowered
Be Relentlessly Focused on the Customer



Benefits

At Corcentric, we know that the hard work of our employees is what drives the success of our organization. We care about who you are and what you value, both inside and outside of work.

Within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with smart, collaborative team members and approachable leaders. Our down-to-earth, solutions-oriented culture means you'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with interesting work projects and be able to draw a short line from your contributions to business impacts. We prioritize professional development and encourage cross-functional promotional opportunities to enable you to reach your career goals. We have been in business for over 25 years and are thrilled to be actively growing and scaling our teams accordingly - it's an exciting environment and a great time to join.

We also recognize the importance of work-life balance and want to support your efforts to take care of your health and well-being and the health and well-being of those who depend upon you. In support of this, we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to our full-time team members, including:


Generous annual paid time off program that increases with tenure
Nine paid holidays plus an annual personal holiday to recognize or celebrate an occasion that is important to you
An annual paid day off to volunteer for causes that are near and dear to you
Paid maternity, paternal/secondary caregiver, and adoptive parent leave
Company-paid life and disability insurance
401k program with a company match
Medical insurance plan options ranging from a traditional PPO to High Deductible Health Plan options that feature a company HSA contribution
Dental plan - including orthodontia coverage
Vision plan - including discount for LASIK surgery
All medical, dental, and vision insurance plans are available from the first of the month following your start date - no extended waiting period to be eligible!
A no-cost Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 access to confidential counseling services and a wide range of additional support and professional services


Our roles require routine use of standard office equipment, such as computers, keyboards, printers, phones, and filing cabinets. You may need to type, reach, and lift office materials of a reasonable weight. Travel may also be required based on job responsibilities and business needs.

Corcentric does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.
Show more

Title: Analyst - Data & Analytics
Description:
Understands and articulates the business case of business questions and the estimated value being delivered. Designs dashboards and analyses to be performed, and appropriate visualization and analytics tools to use. Identifies trends and patterns to address identified business questions and provide insights through reporting and data visualization techniques. Works with other data and analytics professionals to optimize, refine, automate and scale analysis into repeatable analytics solutions and decision support tools.


Builds various reporting dashboards using the most appropriate data extraction, data cleaning and data visualization techniques.
Provides value through insights, reporting and data visualization techniques. Selects, configures and implements analytics solutions for consistency and repeatability.
Researches and applies continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights.
Works with different teams, management and stakeholders to enhance the usability and aesthetic appeal of data analytics solutions deployed in the organization.
Translates business needs to technical specifications and evaluates existing data visualization systems in order to improve them.
Develops data visualizations of "large" amounts of data that facilitate the intuitive presentation of data to decision makers.
Documents data flow, systems and processes to improve the design, implementation and management of business/group processes.
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.


Qualifications:


Intermediate level of proficiency:


You have strong Excel and PowerPoint skills but prefer to use SQL, Python, and Power BI for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.
Excellent planning and organization skills, and a willingness to manage constantly changing priorities.
Insights design.
Insights development and reporting.
Verbal & written communication skills.
Collaboration & team skills.
Analytical and problem solving skills.
Data driven decision making.
Typically between 2 - 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.



Foundational level of proficiency:


Technical design optimization.
Decision Making.
Systems Thinking.
Data visualization.
Data storytelling.
Data mining.
Illustration.
Creative thinking.
Problem Solving.



Salary:

$48,400.00 - $90,200.00

Pay Type:

Salaried

The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type.

Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position.

BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

BMO is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected. characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/us/en

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: 2817 - Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Remote Data Analyst (Tableau) opportunity. US Citizenship is required for this client

We are searching for a Data Analyst to join our experienced team. This role primarily performs data ETL (extract, transformation, load) activities and report development. The main tool used for data ETL is Alteryx, with inputs and outputs to primarily SQL Server databases. The primary tool used for report development is Tableau.

This role is a member of a team that develops and supports reporting and analytics for internal and external stakeholders. As such, the individual will be exposed to a number of departments and programs within the business.

Primary Responsibilities:



Performs data analysis, report development, requirements gathering, testing and maintenance
Primarily uses data analytics tools such as Tableau and Alteryx
Supports architecting and building of database tables to increase efficiency and quality
Interacts and communicates with developers, program team, external customers, and other stakeholders to support delivery of reporting products
Proactively updates managers and teammates on status, next steps, recommendations, and risks
Supports work to improve and standardize processes and technology
Contributes to positive team culture



Required Qualifications:



Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience
3+ years of experience with report development, specifically in Tableau and Alteryx.
3+ years of experience with data analysis (e.g., SQL, ability to analyze data, database concepts)
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in SQL
Experience with requirements gathering
Experience working with stakeholders and leaders in a matrixed environment
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Excel, Visio, Teams)
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Strong communication, organization, collaboration, learning, adaptability, and critical thinking skills



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience in healthcare industry
Experience with any additional tools that are utilized in broader organization including: Amazon Redshift, SSRS, SSIS, PowerBI
Exposure to Agile development methodology

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RANE is hiring a Data Analyst to support our growing Data Operations team. This is a hybrid role where the Data Analyst will have dual responsibilities across our Data Operations and Development teams. The Analyst will gain broad exposure to various aspects of RANE’s product offerings and will play an integral role in creating and maintaining data across the RANE organization.

 

The Data Analyst’s primary responsibilities will be to create queries and dashboards related to usage metrics, analyze usage data for stakeholders, and assist in the integration of artificial intelligence with our content improvement processes. In this position, the Analyst will play an integral in creating visualization dashboards for broader dissemination of usage metrics across RANE. The Data Analyst is also responsible for analyzing customer data to identify platform usage trends for the analyst, product and sales team to make more informed decisions. They will also play a key role in ensuring that our machine learning/AI processes continue to meet RANE’s quality standards.

 

This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing, B2B startup serving the dynamic market for enterprise risk management. 

 

This position is remote, preferably on the East Coast, with a preference for candidates based in the New England to New York area.

‍

‍Job Responsibilities Include:

Running existing database queries
Creating queries for custom database reports
Creating data visualizations to be used by executive, sales, product and analyst teams
Analyzing data for trend identification
Collaborating across data operations, product, development and quality assurance teams

Desired Skills and Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering or another technical discipline
Fluent in English
Working knowledge of AWS, elastic search, Python, basic shell scripting
Experience writing queries against Elasticsearch, including aggregating over multiple attributes
Experience writing complex SQL queries for MySQL database, like aggregate and pivot over multiple fields
Experience converting JSON to CSV file format conversions
Experience working in data collection, analysis and quality control
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or similar platforms
Intermediate excel skills, ability to perform SUM, IF, VLOOKUP, DATE and TEXT functions
Detail-oriented research and analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work collaboratively and effectively across multiple internal teams and stakeholders

‍

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at RANE. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

HTML:
RANE is hiring a Data Analyst to support our growing Data Operations team. This is a hybrid role where the Data Analyst will have dual responsibilities across our Data Operations and Development teams. The Analyst will gain broad exposure to various aspects of RANE’s product offerings and will play an integral role in creating and maintaining data across the RANE organization.

 

The Data Analyst’s primary responsibilities will be to create queries and dashboards related to usage metrics, analyze usage data for stakeholders, and assist in the integration of artificial intelligence with our content improvement processes. In this position, the Analyst will play an integral in creating visualization dashboards for broader dissemination of usage metrics across RANE. The Data Analyst is also responsible for analyzing customer data to identify platform usage trends for the analyst, product and sales team to make more informed decisions. They will also play a key role in ensuring that our machine learning/AI processes continue to meet RANE’s quality standards.

 

This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing, B2B startup serving the dynamic market for enterprise risk management. 

 

This position is remote, preferably on the East Coast, with a preference for candidates based in the New England to New York area.

‍

‍Job Responsibilities Include:

  • Running existing database queries
  • Creating queries for custom database reports
  • Creating data visualizations to be used by executive, sales, product and analyst teams
  • Analyzing data for trend identification
  • Collaborating across data operations, product, development and quality assurance teams

Desired Skills and Requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering or another technical discipline
  • Fluent in English
  • Working knowledge of AWS, elastic search, Python, basic shell scripting
  • Experience writing queries against Elasticsearch, including aggregating over multiple attributes
  • Experience writing complex SQL queries for MySQL database, like aggregate and pivot over multiple fields
  • Experience converting JSON to CSV file format conversions
  • Experience working in data collection, analysis and quality control
  • Experience creating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or similar platforms
  • Intermediate excel skills, ability to perform SUM, IF, VLOOKUP, DATE and TEXT functions
  • Detail-oriented research and analytical skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work collaboratively and effectively across multiple internal teams and stakeholders

‍

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at RANE. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Recognized as a 2024 Top Workplace by the Tennessean, EnableComp is the leading source of revenue cycle management solutions for complex claims in the US. We proudly partner with well over 1000+ hospitals across the US to help them maximize their revenue from complex claims.

Our Mission

We partner with healthcare providers to maximize reimbursement from complex claims payers by having the best people, processes, products and performance.

Our Vision

We enable healthcare providers to do what they do best.

Position Summary

The Data Analyst responsibilities will include but not limited to quantitative analysis and predictive modeling of healthcare data to provide management with statistical findings and conclusions.  The ideal candidate should be able to develop, collect and analyze metrics and data to formulate fact-based decisions and proactively implement process improvements through analysis of claim and operational data.




Key Responsibilities
Ability to transform complex datasets into executive-level summaries, and communicate findings clearly and succinctly
Managing multiple projects and deadlines so you will need excellent time management and prioritization skills to meet multiple deadlines
Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills; strong understanding of analytics results, as well as the ability to identify a problem and develop and execute new solutions to obtain results
Effectively communicate results to key stakeholders and policy makers; communication of results include clean and well-organized presentations to reflect analytic methods used and to illustrate key decision points with sufficient detail to support comprehension and replication of the analysis
Data responsibilities include identifying necessary data elements to build measures, querying data to limit large data sets, joining tables to build analytic views, other data prep, and documentation of process and results; working with external data management team to receive, load, and analyze new data
Ability to communicate with BA and IT to understand requirements, socialize ideas among peers and document work product
Solid hands-on experience and knowledge of database concepts
Ability to work independently given minimal direction
Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation, as well as the ability to step back and see the big picture
Other duties as required




Requirements and Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree
2+ years’ experience with analytics, reporting, and relational databases
2 years’ experience working in a healthcare, SaaS or other similar environment.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL Server
Familiarity with healthcare terminology such as diagnosis code, CPT, claim ID, DRG, inpatient, outpatient, etc.
Experience with BI tool (Power BI/Tableau/Qlik)
Experience with statistical models and predictive analytics
Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
Must have strong computer proficiency and understand how to use basic office applications, including MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
Regular and predictable attendance.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Special Considerations and Prerequisites
Strong communication and presentation skills; ability to explain complex analytic results to an audience of varying levels of technical understanding required
Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation
Strong planning, organizational, and multi-tasking skills
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills, written and verbal
Ownership of body of work







EnableComp is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. All applicants will be considered for this position based upon experience and knowledge, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.

EnableComp recruits, develops and retains the industry's top talent.  As the employer of choice in the complex claims industry, EnableComp takes pride in our continuous commitment to building and maintaining a culture centered around fostering the professional growth and development of our people.  We believe that investing in our employees is the key to our success, and we are dedicated to providing them with the tools, resources, and support they need to thrive and grow their career here. At EnableComp, we are committed to living up to our core values each and every day, and we believe that this commitment is what sets us apart from other companies.  If you are looking for a company that values its employees and is dedicated to helping them achieve their full potential, then EnableComp is the place for you.

 Don’t just take our word for it!  Hear what our people are saying:

“I love my job because everyone shares the same vision and is determined and dedicated. People care about you as a person and your professional growth. There is a genuine spirit of cooperation and shared goals all revolving around helping each other.” – Revenue Specialist

“I enjoy working for EnableComp because of the Core Values we believe in. EnableComp stands true to these values from empowering employees to ecstatic clients. This company is family oriented and flexible, along with understanding the balance of work, life, and fun.” – Supervisor, Operations

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Value Add is the leading research journal for the operating side of private equity. We explore how PE firms are creating value in portfolio companies through performance improvement, management changes, restructuring, digital transformation, and other tactics.




We're hiring and looking for analysts to collect data about private equity deals. Unlike typical data entry roles, these positions are research intensive as you'll be digging through financial reports (S-1 filings, annual reports, press releases, news reports, etc). Therefore, an interest in private equity and finance is a plus for candidates.




The time commitment is 20 hours per month (at a rate of $25 /hr), making this a great fit for students or professionals seeking some extra income.




Responsibilities

Look-up financial metrics for a list of companies
Record data in an Excel spreadsheet




Qualifications

Familiarity with company reports and financial statements
Experience with large-scale data collection
Methodical, accurate, and double-checks work
Good communication and project management skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What Working at Hexaware offers:

Hexaware is a dynamic and innovative IT organization committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients worldwide. We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment where every team member is valued and empowered to succeed.

Hexaware provides access to a vast array of tools that enhance, revolutionize, and advance professional profile. We complete the circle with excellent growth opportunities, chances to collaborate with highly visible customers, chances to work alongside bright brains, and the perfect work-life balance.

With an ever-expanding portfolio of capabilities, we delve deep into and identify the source of our motivation. Although technology is at the core of our solutions, it is still the people and their passion that fuel Hexaware’s commitment towards creating smiles.

“At Hexaware we encourage to challenge oneself to achieve full potential and propel growth. We trust and empower to disrupt the status quo and innovate for a better future. We encourage an open and inspiring culture that fosters learning and brings talented, passionate, and caring people together.”

We are always interested in, and want to support, the professional and personal you. We offer a wide array of programs to help expand skills and supercharge careers. We help discover passion—the driving force that makes one smile and innovate, create, and make a difference every day.




The Hexaware Advantage: Your Workplace Benefits

Excellent Health benefits with low-cost employee premium.
Wide range of voluntary benefits such as Legal, Identity theft and Critical Care Coverage
Unlimited training and upskilling opportunities through Udemy and Hexavarsity




Role: Data Analyst with strong SQL and AWS

Location: Reston, VA

Experience: 8+ years

Work Mode: Reston, VA with minimum 3 days / week onsite is required)

Location: Client Location/Offshore

Salary Range: $115K




Job Key Responsibilities:







Job description:




Data Analyst JD

10+ year of experience as a data analysis

Must have strong experience in Data Analysis in an enterprise DWH environment like Redshift.

Advanced knowledge in SQL writing is required.

Experience with BI tool like Tableau

Understanding of data lineage concepts

Experience with SQL and querying databases

Experience with software requirements management and testing

Knowledge of mortgage finance a plus

Knowledge of the Agile software development methodology a plus

Collaborate with application owners to review defined business processes.

Review and define technical and/or data requirements for moderately complex application enhancements.

Contribute to application test plan and evaluate test results.

Conduct requirement analysis and advanced work for new capabilities and enhancements for products and services owned by Enterprise data

Work with Product Owners and Scrum teams and lead discussion on features and requirements and weigh in design decisions for products and technology solutions.

Communicate product vision, capabilities, and value to various audiences. Prepare product briefing at pertinent stages of releases.

Provide consultation and training for product adoption, provide business domain and/or technology and/or process expertise across teams and mentoring to others on team.

Establish test scenarios, participate and review tests, and perform post-production validations for release

Strong analyst background in data-oriented applications

Must have experience working in large, fast paced Agile projects.

Knowledge of Mortgage Industry – must be able to understand mortgage data.

Prior experience with Secondary Mortgage firms is a plus.













Privacy Statement:

The information you provide will be used in accordance with the terms of our Privacy Policy and will be used specifically for the business/processing purpose of the event. You should be aware that we may share your details with our approved vendors for this event to be handled successfully.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




The Data Analyst will work within the PMO of Division, and Practice Program Management team to develop reports dashboards to equip President and SVP with information necessary for contract compliance, planning and forecasting of resources. This position involves collecting, processing, and performing statistical analyses on large datasets to identify trends and patterns. This role is highly collaborative and serves as a communication agent, engaging with coding teams, leadership, and the client to ensure client satisfaction with project delivery.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyzes needs of data with SME’s and determines appropriate tools for capture and display
Participates in planning for new technology needs for practice
Gathers and maintains data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Analyzes complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends. Utilize statistical tools and techniques to interpret data.
Creates and presents comprehensive reports and dashboards that summarize findings and provide recommendations to stakeholders.
Develops visual representations of data, including charts, graphs, and dashboards, to communicate findings effectively.
Works closely with other departments to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Ensures the integrity of data by performing regular audits and data validation checks.
Identifies and resolves data-related issues and inconsistencies.
Stays up to date with industry trends and best practices to enhance data analysis processes.
Fosters a collaborative environment to promote knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
Provides administrative support as needed.
Explores operational improvements and collaborate with operational teams to design and implement.
Works closely with the leadership team to identify operational trends to drive continuous improvement.




Qualifications:

In-depth knowledge of network security principles, technologies, and best practices.
Experience with data analysis, reporting, and project management.
Adaptable and highly agile-must be comfortable being a doer and a facilitator depending on focus for the project.
Experience building dashboards.
Knowledge of SQL and ability to create complex ad-hoc statements involving large datasets.
Reporting experience, preferably with Crystal Reports, or other technologies that interface with databases.
Proficiency with MS Excel, including VLOOKUP and Pivot tables.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong organization skills; able to keep track of high-volume tasks.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and clients, establishing and maintaining effective working relationships.
Ability to be flexible and adaptable to an ever-changing environment.
Comfortable with prioritization and competing deadlines.
Superior analytical skills and can research solutions and make recommendations.
Confidently develops plans to meet goals and can articulate team roles in achieving them.
Ability to see the big picture and think broader to advance project goals.
Strong time management skills.
Ability to drive tasks forward to completion.
Applicant Tracking System knowledge preferred (Bullhorn a plus).
Demonstrates resiliency, shows initiative, driven, persistent.
Ability to handle competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated with an ability to work independently.
Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) with advanced Excel skills.




Education & Certification:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Experience with data analysis tools and techniques.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.




Aside from a benefits package that is a cut above the rest, you will gain access to an award-winning company culture. Want to see for yourself?

With CSI, you will gain access to….

Healthcare coverage plus HSA matching
Fitness challenges with incentives & rewards for participation
Participation in 401(k) retirement plan
Competitive compensation plan
An award-winning corporate culture

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
As a People Data Analyst at Kearney, you will support the global HR programs and initiatives by creating tools and presenting data in a manner that educates, informs, and influences the decisions of HR clients and business leaders. This role works closely with the Global Compensation team in Chicago, but also collaborates with Talent Management, HR, Digital HR, and finance teams globally.




Working alongside a dedicated and diverse set of people, you will broaden your knowledge and experience in an open, agile, and collaborative environment. With the freedom to be yourself and recognition for what you bring to the table, you can put your purpose into action and help build a future that works for everyone, everywhere—as a Kearney Original.




Key responsibilities

Leverages analytical and technical skills to process and interpret data from multiple internal and external sources to provide support to HR and other internal teams in understanding firm people statistics.
Works with internal stakeholders to answer data and reporting questions for firm statistics.
Increases self service capabilities of end users by building straightforward meaningful solutions.
Works collaboratively within the People Analytics team and broader R&A function in the development, production, and continuous improvement of existing and new reports.
Understand, identify, locate, and extract data from a variety of sources for use in analysis.
Maintain data feeds that support Power Bi dashboards.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal clients.




Who you are

After nearly 100 years, we know this business is fundamentally about making connections—between facts, figures, insights, strategies, tools, technologies, and above all, people. That’s why we look for collaborative, insightful, and inquisitive problem-solvers who don’t accept the first thing in front of them and who are always unapologetically themselves.




We want to hear from you if you are:




Ready to share your ideas and contribute as soon as you join a team
Analytically inclined and enjoy solving problems
Able to prioritize and are a doer by nature
3-5 years of relevant work experience
Possess an undergraduate degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field is preferred
Fluent in English
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Proficient with PowerBI
Experienced with HR information systems (PeopleSoft preferred)




What we can offer you

Every day, our people work to be the difference for our clients, our communities, and our colleagues. Helping them make an impact, they are sustained by a competitive remuneration package plus comprehensive benefits and perks, including but not limited to:




Generous retirement/pension savings contributions
Comprehensive medical insurance for employees and their families
Non-partner equity-based awards (for consulting managers and above)
Structured and on-the-job learning and development opportunities
Personalized opportunities including talent mobility, flexible work programs and externships to help you chart a unique career journey to pursue your own personal and professional goals




Equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination

Kearney prides itself on providing a culture where our employees belong and thrive equally, which means our people feel comfort, confidence, and joy as they do great things for our firm, our colleagues, and our clients. That’s why Kearney is committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive environment. Kearney is an equal opportunity employer; we recruit, hire, train, promote, develop, and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race or ethnicity, religion, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other differences consistent with applicable laws. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for disabilities or religious beliefs and practices. We encourage everyone to apply, including those who may not feel historically represented in consulting.

Show more
HTML:
As a People Data Analyst at Kearney, you will support the global HR programs and initiatives by creating tools and presenting data in a manner that educates, informs, and influences the decisions of HR clients and business leaders. This role works closely with the Global Compensation team in Chicago, but also collaborates with Talent Management, HR, Digital HR, and finance teams globally.


Working alongside a dedicated and diverse set of people, you will broaden your knowledge and experience in an open, agile, and collaborative environment. With the freedom to be yourself and recognition for what you bring to the table, you can put your purpose into action and help build a future that works for everyone, everywhere—as a Kearney Original.


Key responsibilities

  • Leverages analytical and technical skills to process and interpret data from multiple internal and external sources to provide support to HR and other internal teams in understanding firm people statistics.
  • Works with internal stakeholders to answer data and reporting questions for firm statistics.
  • Increases self service capabilities of end users by building straightforward meaningful solutions.
  • Works collaboratively within the People Analytics team and broader R&A function in the development, production, and continuous improvement of existing and new reports.
  • Understand, identify, locate, and extract data from a variety of sources for use in analysis.
  • Maintain data feeds that support Power Bi dashboards.
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal clients.


Who you are

After nearly 100 years, we know this business is fundamentally about making connections—between facts, figures, insights, strategies, tools, technologies, and above all, people. That’s why we look for collaborative, insightful, and inquisitive problem-solvers who don’t accept the first thing in front of them and who are always unapologetically themselves.


We want to hear from you if you are:


  • Ready to share your ideas and contribute as soon as you join a team
  • Analytically inclined and enjoy solving problems
  • Able to prioritize and are a doer by nature
  • 3-5 years of relevant work experience
  • Possess an undergraduate degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field is preferred
  • Fluent in English
  • Proficient with Microsoft Excel
  • Proficient with PowerBI
  • Experienced with HR information systems (PeopleSoft preferred)


What we can offer you

Every day, our people work to be the difference for our clients, our communities, and our colleagues. Helping them make an impact, they are sustained by a competitive remuneration package plus comprehensive benefits and perks, including but not limited to:


  • Generous retirement/pension savings contributions
  • Comprehensive medical insurance for employees and their families
  • Non-partner equity-based awards (for consulting managers and above)
  • Structured and on-the-job learning and development opportunities
  • Personalized opportunities including talent mobility, flexible work programs and externships to help you chart a unique career journey to pursue your own personal and professional goals


Equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination

Kearney prides itself on providing a culture where our employees belong and thrive equally, which means our people feel comfort, confidence, and joy as they do great things for our firm, our colleagues, and our clients. That’s why Kearney is committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive environment. Kearney is an equal opportunity employer; we recruit, hire, train, promote, develop, and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race or ethnicity, religion, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other differences consistent with applicable laws. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for disabilities or religious beliefs and practices. We encourage everyone to apply, including those who may not feel historically represented in consulting.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Job Location: Savannah GA 31406

Onsite Requirements:

Running SQL queries to pull data from Snowflake
Build reporting from data using Qlik
Strong understanding of business metrics/KPIs

Job Description:

Essential Functions / Duties Performed Regularly:

Analyze and interpret data from various marketing campaigns to uncover trends, patterns, and insights related to performance and identify areas for improvement.
Monitor and evaluate call center metrics, such as call volumes, service levels, customer satisfaction, and resolution times.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track key performance indicators (KPIs) and marketing effectiveness.
Collaborate with marketing teams to design and implement A/B testing frameworks and measure the impact of various campaigns.
Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize marketing spend and improve return on investment (ROI).
Work with customer service managers to improve call center operations and customer engagement strategies.
Utilize advanced analytics techniques to forecast trends and model potential outcomes of marketing and customer service initiatives.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in analytics and performance marketing tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Work Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within a marketing or advertising context.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
Statistical Knowledge: Proficiency in statistical tests, distributions, and regression analysis.
Data Visualization: Skill in creating clear visual representations of data using tools like Tableau or Power BI.
SQL: Strong command of SQL for querying databases.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in programming languages - SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools.
Machine Learning: Understanding of basic machine learning algorithms and their application in marketing data.
A/B Testing: Experience in designing and interpreting A/B tests to optimize campaign performance.
Data Mining: Ability to extract data from various sources and prepare it for analysis
Strong communication skills: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Physical Requirements:

Standing, walking, sitting, movement and use of mechanical controls, such as keyboard, are frequently required.

** 3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.

This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future **

Title: Analista de Datos Jr
Description:
Descripción Del Puesto

Estamos en búsqueda de un(a) Analista de Datos Junior para unirse a nuestro equipo. La persona seleccionada será responsable de la recopilación, revisión y análisis de datos, así como del apoyo en la gestión de inventarios y materiales. Esta es una excelente oportunidad para aquellos que tienen afinidad con los números y desean desarrollarse en el campo del análisis de datos.

Requisitos

Edad: Entre 20 y 35 años.

Formación Académica: Carreras afines a las matemáticas, ingeniería, ciencia de datos, estadística, economía o cualquier perfil relacionado con el análisis numérico.Experiencia: No se requiere experiencia previa. Buscamos candidatos que sean aprendices o juniors. También consideramos becarios que tengan el deseo de aprender y desarrollarse en el área.

Habilidades


Afinidad con los números y el análisis de datos.
Capacidad para manejar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Atención al detalle y habilidades analíticas.
Proactividad y deseo de aprendizaje continuo.


Responsabilidades


Recopilación y análisis de datos.
Revisión y gestión de materiales.
Apoyo en la elaboración de informes y reportes analíticos.
Colaboración con otros departamentos para la implementación de estrategias basadas en datos.


Ofrecemos


Capacitación y desarrollo continuo.
Oportunidades de crecimiento dentro de la empresa.
Un ambiente de trabajo dinámico y colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Compensation Range:

$35.00 - $43.00/hr

Welcome to IntePros, a certified woman-owned company specializing in innovative and results-oriented recruiting and staffing solutions. We take immense pride in genuinely understanding what drives and inspires exceptional individuals like you. Your success is our priority, and we are dedicated to actively shaping your long-term career journey. At IntePros, we believe in comprehensive well-being. You have access to our medical, dental, vision, and mental health programs, ensuring your health and wellness are taken care of. To support your continuous growth, we also provide a $1,500 per year education and professional certification fund. Diversity and inclusion are cornerstones of our company ethos. IntePros is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran or military status, retaliation, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate the rich tapestry of backgrounds and perspectives that make us stronger as a team. Please note that only qualified individuals being considered will be contacted. We appreciate your interest and look forward to potentially embarking on a transformative journey together.

Data Analyst II

IntePros is looking for a Data Analyst to work 5 days a week on-site, with paid parking for our client located in Seattle, WA. This is an exciting role that will be a part of a order and fulfillment management team launching and introducing new cloud product lines to internal teams.

Responsibilities:


Manage all aspects of Order and Fulfillment Management
Triage blockers for orders as flagged by internal ordering system
Track multiple deliverables / tickets with internal partners to closure
Manage Order and fulfillment related instances such as PO modifications



What are the top three MUST HAVE skill sets (technical) required?


Strong SQL skills
MS Excel
Analytical Skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.



What are the top three PREFERRED skill sets (technical)?


3+ years of professional experience.
Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, engineering, or related field
2+ years of supply chain, order and fulfillment management experience

Title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will join a driven, collaborative team within an ambitious, entrepreneurial global organization. You will work collaboratively within the Data & Analytics team supporting internal reporting for Global Client Services. This role requires a proactive individual who takes ownership of all assigned work and thrives in a collaborative team environment.

We pride ourselves on being a positive work environment, and place value on a work/life balance. This means thoughtful, sustainable workloads, as well as professional development opportunities to help you reach your career goals.

We are currently hiring out of the following office location(s):


Cherry Hill, NJ
Downers Grove, IL


This role may be eligible for voluntary work-from-home consideration. In order to be considered for this position, you should live within a commutable distance to one of these office locations, even if you plan to request a work-from-home arrangement, as there may be times when in-person meetings, training sessions, social events, or similar activities are held onsite.

This key position reports to the Director, Source-to-Pay Data & Analytics within our Advisory team. We're a dedicated, down-to-earth group in a growing organization offering plenty of opportunity. We look forward to adding you into the mix!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will:


Handle diverse data inputs and transform them into valuable insights, demonstrating strong data organization and cleansing skills, ensuring that data is presented in a format that is clear and accessible to team members.
Utilize tools and techniques to clean and standardize data, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and identify key outcomes for reporting.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders (technical and non-technical) in clear and concise formats
Demonstrate exceptional communication skills, documenting and articulating findings and action items



Requirements

You'll need to have:


Bachelor's or Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Business Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience with business intelligence software such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal (English).
Knowledge in Programming Languages (SQL, Python) for querying and manipulating data stored in databases
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality reporting
A strong work ethic, self-motivation and progressive thinking, thriving on new challenges.
Ability to self-manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects.


(We want to make sure you're set up to succeed, and we view these as the critical skills you'll need to achieve great things at Corcentric!)

As we continue to grow our Advisory practice, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, we would like to communicate the following:


We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth minded
We prioritize both the process and outcome of work, demonstrating a strong commitment to the success of our customers and colleagues. Exceptional quality work is an essential standard for us.
We operate within a voluntary work-from-home framework, yet we uphold the same level of accountability and responsibility as in a traditional office setting



About Us

Corcentric is a global provider of business spend management and revenue management software and services for mid-market and Fortune 1000 businesses. Corcentric delivers software, advisory services, and payments focused on reducing costs, optimizing working capital, and unlocking revenue.

We achieve success by exemplifying our core values in the way we work, communicate, and collaborate:


Do the Right Thing
Embrace + Drive Change
Be Empowered
Be Relentlessly Focused on the Customer



Benefits

At Corcentric, we know that the hard work of our employees is what drives the success of our organization. We care about who you are and what you value, both inside and outside of work.

Within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with smart, collaborative team members and approachable leaders. Our down-to-earth, solutions-oriented culture means you'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with interesting work projects and be able to draw a short line from your contributions to business impacts. We prioritize professional development and encourage cross-functional promotional opportunities to enable you to reach your career goals. We have been in business for over 25 years and are thrilled to be actively growing and scaling our teams accordingly - it's an exciting environment and a great time to join.

We also recognize the importance of work-life balance and want to support your efforts to take care of your health and well-being and the health and well-being of those who depend upon you. In support of this, we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to our full-time team members, including:


Generous annual paid time off program that increases with tenure
Nine paid holidays plus an annual personal holiday to recognize or celebrate an occasion that is important to you
An annual paid day off to volunteer for causes that are near and dear to you
Paid maternity, paternal/secondary caregiver, and adoptive parent leave
Company-paid life and disability insurance
401k program with a company match
Medical insurance plan options ranging from a traditional PPO to High Deductible Health Plan options that feature a company HSA contribution
Dental plan - including orthodontia coverage
Vision plan - including discount for LASIK surgery
All medical, dental, and vision insurance plans are available from the first of the month following your start date - no extended waiting period to be eligible!
A no-cost Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 access to confidential counseling services and a wide range of additional support and professional services


Our roles require routine use of standard office equipment, such as computers, keyboards, printers, phones, and filing cabinets. You may need to type, reach, and lift office materials of a reasonable weight. Travel may also be required based on job responsibilities and business needs.

Corcentric does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

  • Paid maternity, paternal/secondary caregiver, and adoptive parent leave
  • Company-paid life and disability insurance
  • 401k program with a company match
  • Medical insurance plan options ranging from a traditional PPO to High Deductible Health Plan options that feature a company HSA contribution

  • Vision plan - including discount for LASIK surgery

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst II: 100% Remote




MUST HAVE: Qlik Sense, SQL, Snowflake, Python, and PowerBI or Tableau

Cannot work with vendors or C2C, must be able to work on a W2!




Responsibilities

Analyze clickstream datasets to uncover customer journeys and paths
Combine clickstream data with product telemetry to find gaps and overlaps
Develop reusable data models in Snowflake, Tableau, or both to allow for ongoing analysis
Educate and enlighten data stakeholders with newly available objects and models that will unlock product and business insights
Deliver executive dashboards and product insights based on foundational productionalized data models
Partner with other Business Data Analysts to create composite measures and insights that span the product unit
Ensure that data privacy and governance is a first priority at all stages of the data lifecycle




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
Must have 3+ years of experience with PowerBI or Tableau
3+ years of experience in data management, data engineering, data analytics, product management or a similar background
2+ years of SQL experience
Experience with Qlik Sense
Strong attention to detail with a focus on profiling datasets for completeness, structure, and accuracy
Ability to communicate findings to a wide range of audiences both technical and non-technical alike
2+ years experience with Cloud based data warehouse technologies (Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, etc.)
Preferred experience with Data engineering (Python, dbt, Kafka, Parquet, Fivetran, Hightouch, etc.)

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Specifications

Black Hills Energy is people powered and purpose driven. Our team uses the power of energy to improve life for over one million customers in 800+ communities across the West and Midwest. We seek talented, caring people who embody our core values and contribute to a culture of inclusion and growth. As an organization, we believe the best part of working on our team is our commitment to making tomorrow better than today—for our customers, communities and each other.

Position Summary

Our company is looking for an experienced technologist who loves solving complex software and data problems. In this role, you will interact with our internal clients and other team members to gather requirements for the creation of an enterprise data cloud solution to build data models for various data domains established within the enterprise. You will work closely with the data architecture team to finalize the model and will be responsible for producing data catalog, data dictionary, and data mapping documents. You will take the approval from the management team and submit the proposed solutions to the data engineering team for the build-out. You will be responsible for testing and signing off on the requirement from data & analytics department once the model development is complete. You will also be supporting Enterprise Data & Analytics environments and perform on-call support on a need basis. You may be required to consume and build Power BI semantic models based on the data mapping document.

Pay Range: $92,500 - $152,450 / Grade 17 (This posting includes the full pay range for this position. Pay is based on a number of factors and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity.)

Reporting Relationship: Manager Data Solutions

Location: This position may be located in Fayetteville, Arkansas; Rapid City, South Dakota; or Council Bluffs, Iowa.

Essential Functions


Collaborate with cross-functional teams in different data domains to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations and solutions.
Design & develop data models, data catalogs & data dictionaries as part of data governance framework.
Ensure all documentation are complete in regard to the requirements, with the need to seek approval before commencing any work.
Manage data quality & integrity, including identifying and resolving data anomalies and inconsistencies in a timely manner.
Perform project management tasks on varied sized projects as necessary.
Apply several data profiling techniques to document and validate the structure, quality, and compliance of source data.
Follow industry best practices and ensure data models are future ready and is scalable, reliable, and secure in the data space.
Define reconciliation process between data cloud and source systems to ensure data integrity.


Additional Responsibilities


Provide on-call support for enterprise data applications on a rolling calendar basis. Data engineering team will provide the training to perform the support.


What You'll Need


Bachelor's Degree Information Technology or related specialty, or equivalent combination of education and experience
5 or more years Hands on experience working & developing various data models and process related artifacts for data engineering, ELT & reporting use cases.
Advanced knowledge of SQL languages, predominately TSQL and PL/SQL.
Extensive understanding of relational databases, data warehouse architecture & principles, CDC techniques and dimensional modeling.
Advanced knowledge of information engineering concepts, including business area analysis, business system design, data modeling, data governance and data security.
Customer service mindset, ability to work effectively in a professional manner with technology staff, business stakeholders, end users. management and others outside the organization.
Ability to lead meetings with technical peers and upper management regarding data solutions.
Ability to set priorities, handle multiple projects and meet deadlines with no oversight in an agile work environment.
Strong analytical, communication, and collaboration skills.
Strong data profiling skills to analyze source system information.


What Is Desired Or Can Be Taught


Any cloud certifications related to data.
Good understanding of cloud data infrastructure including but not limited to Azure Data factory, Azure Synapse, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI,
Good understanding of big data technologies such as Apache Spark to process & handle large datasets.
Good understanding of Data Lake, Serverless Architecture & Delta Lake to implement delta Lakehouse architecture.
Good understanding of extracting data through REST; Working knowledge of processing and storing complex data structures ingested through REST.
Overall understanding of Power BI & Semantic Models.


This description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, duties, and requirements for employees in this position. Job descriptions may and do change periodically. Where positions are covered by a collective bargaining unit agreement, the terms and conditions of the agreement will apply.

About our Company: We are a customer, growth and safety focused utility company that is dedicated to our communities. We improve life with energy as an energy partner of choice. Our diverse culture fuels unique perspectives, opening doors to new insights and possibilities. Based in Rapid City, South Dakota, we have over 3000 employees and serve 1.3 million natural gas and electric utility customers across eight states (South Dakota, Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, Nebraska, Iowa, Kansas, and Arkansas).

Enjoy our Comprehensive Benefits Package! Annual discretionary bonuses, 401(k) (6% company match and up to 9% company retirement contribution), tuition reimbursement, generous paid time off benefits, including paid holidays and parental leave, company paid life insurance and disability benefits (short and long term), an employee assistance program and well-being benefits, and competitive medical, dental and vision insurance.

Candidates must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check.

Black Hills Energy does not sponsor applicants for work visas. All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or status as a protected veteran. If you require reasonable accommodation, please visit careers.blackhillsenergy.com for more information.
