Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
General Summary

The Analyst, Data I is part of a team that shares the responsibility for success and profitability by providing services to our customers which may include: data warehousing, post audits, reporting, carrier bids management, dashboard creation, project management, transportation analysis, application mastery, consulting support, and data analysis. The Data Analyst works with customers, carriers, and internal employees to analyze and identify cost saving opportunities for customers.

Primary Responsibilities

Manage data gathering for customers’ benchmark key performance metrics.

Create a strategic approach to carrier bids through lane, mode, and service balancing (Bid team) by performing the following tasks: Scorecard and performance tracking, transportation dashboard, on-going analysis of data.

Determine the best mode, carrier, and service for the customer, resulting in customer savings by providing the analysis and metrics for transportation bids.

Use professional judgment to assess the impact of decisions/actions on the customer and the Company which would be approved by both the customer and the person’s leader.

Act as an internal technical resource for role specific applications.

Analyze large amounts of data and then recommend broad based innovative improvement initiatives for customer(s).

Reporting and analyzing on an ad hoc basis for the customer.

Develop customer presentations showing data trends and possible solutions to the customer. Collaborate with the objective of agreeing to the most effective and profitable solution for the customer, carrier, and the Company.

Developing standard operating procedures based on the direction from manager.

Qualifications - External

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Engineering, Accounting/Finance or related field preferred and 0-2 years of relevant experience.

In lieu of degree, high school diploma or GED and 2+ years of relevant experience.

Proficient with technology, specifically Microsoft applications such as Access and Excel.

Experience with SQL is preferred.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with internal and external customers.

Experience or knowledge in transportation, logistics, parcel shipping or freight pay is preferred.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Physical/Cognitive Requirements

With or without accommodation:

Ability to follow policies and procedures.
Ability to read, write and interpret information.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to use hands to manipulate, handle, or feel.
Ability to sit/walk/stand for up to 8 hours per day.
Must possess visual acuity, i.e., close, distance, and color vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Working Conditions

General office environment that is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment with standard office equipment available.

Disclaimer

The above information is only an illustration of the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this classification. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position.

The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the Company and employee and is subject to change by the Company as the needs of the Company and requirements of the job change.




FedEx Supply Chain is an equal opportunity employers. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The FedEx Supply Chain is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in its application procedures, hiring, and other terms and conditions of employment. To request a reasonable accommodation, please contact FSC.TalentAcquisition@fedex.com.

** Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to, market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, education/training and a candidate’s work experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a SaaS start-up that is looking to expand their Engineering team. The data team collaborates closely with all other engineering teams, providing crucial support, making this position exciting as you get to work on many different projects. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in building the platform technology and infrastructure that drives our product delivery.




Responsibilities:




Developing and maintaining metrics and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
Identifying key insights to drive improvements in our processes and systems.
Monitoring system performance and ensuring data integrity.
Detecting, prioritizing, and resolving systemic issues to improve data quality.







Requirements:




Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience with analytics software such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Ability to work independently and strong communication skills
Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision and oversee complex tasks while prioritizing multiple projects based on strategic goals.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with a professional soccer league sanctioned by the US Soccer Federation. They are actively looking to hire a Data Analyst to join their Finance Department for a hybrid, contract assignment. The candidate in this role will review data based on parameters provided, conduct thorough analysis of large data sets, clean data within Excel and Hyperion, and source usable information from data sets. SQL, Python and Excel are a must for this position!

*You must be commutable to NYC for a hybrid schedule for this role!




Primary Responsibilities

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Produces timely and accurate reports, presented in a clear and relevant format
Utilize tools such as Microsoft Power BI to present data, use automation tools available in Microsoft Office 365 Suite
1-2 years of experience

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
At Antora, we’re on a mission to stop climate change. And we can’t do that unless we tackle the 30% of global emissions that come from industry.

Antora is unlocking zero-emissions industrial energy, cheaper than fossil fuels. Antora’s thermal batteries store energy from renewables as heat for days on end, delivering that stored energy as heat and power at the scale and temperatures that large industrial operations demand. We’re on a path to eliminate gigatons of emissions while strengthening domestic manufacturing, curbing industrial air pollution, and enhancing America’s clean energy leadership.

We are growing our company with people who put team and mission first, value connection through laughter and joy, and build with humility and openness. We are committed to continue building a diverse, passionate, and creative team dedicated to a future where every industrial facility, everywhere on earth, is powered by abundant, low-cost, zero-emissions energy.

Position Summary

We are looking for an Energy Markets Data Analyst who understands energy systems and is adept at using sophisticated software tools to gain a comprehensive understanding of complex data. In this role, you will serve as a key member of Antora’s analytics team in deriving insights from diverse data sets, enhancing our understanding of energy market dynamics, trends in industrial decarbonization, and battery operation strategies.

Roles & Responsibilities


Utilize our Python-based optimization software to support strategic corporate decisions regarding battery operations.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our internal Geographic Information Systems (GIS) platform to analyze the geographical dimensions of industrial energy dynamics.
Utilize Excel to conduct high-level financial analysis of project financing and energy market dynamics.
Support ad hoc analysis of various data to support product, market, and strategic decision making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect data and insights, ensuring alignment with current market conditions and strategic objectives.
Support Antora’s Project Development team by conducting analyses and building tools which identify, screen, prioritize, and evaluate the economics/impact of project opportunities.
Prepare and present reports and presentations for customers, investors, and Antora senior management, delivering actionable insights that influence key decisions.
Manage engagements with energy markets consultants to support project financing transactions.



Key Qualifications


Passion for solving climate change
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field with a focus on energy markets.
2-3 years of experience in an analytical role, preferably within the energy sector.
Proficient in multi-disciplinary analysis with the ability to adapt to various domains and toolsets.
Skilled in Python programming, particularly for data analysis and model development.
Familiar with interacting with Snowflake or other SQL-based data warehouses or data lakes.
Experience with ArcGIS or similar geographic information system platforms.
Proficient in Excel for basic financial and data analysis.
Demonstrated ability to create professional and visually appealing PowerPoint presentations.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills.
Deep intellectual curiosity and strong work ethic.
Ability to work independently and excel in an unstructured environment.



Additional Qualifications Desired


Experience in finance or consulting fields
Experience with CPLEX or similar software for linear optimization
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or Keras.
Experience forecasting time-series data utilizing statistical or ML frameworks
Exposure to a formal software development environment as a developer



Work Location: Onsite - San Jose, CA

Salary Range: $96,000 USD - $115,000 USD

Salary Basis: Annual

This job posting contains the salary range that Antora Energy believes it would be willing to pay for the posted job. The actual salary offered will be determined within the posted range based on a candidate's experience, credentials, and expertise as they pertain to the requirements of the position.

In addition to a competitive base salary, Antora Energy’s Total Rewards program includes a premium health benefits package with life and disability insurance, a 401K plan, a flexible spending account, industry leading paid time off policy, providing a flexible and inclusive holiday observance, as well as paid volunteer time off.

We are excited to share our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace.


Show more

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
As a People Data Analyst at Kearney, you will support the global HR programs and initiatives by creating tools and presenting data in a manner that educates, informs, and influences the decisions of HR clients and business leaders. This role works closely with the Global Compensation team in Chicago, but also collaborates with Talent Management, HR, Digital HR, and finance teams globally.




Working alongside a dedicated and diverse set of people, you will broaden your knowledge and experience in an open, agile, and collaborative environment. With the freedom to be yourself and recognition for what you bring to the table, you can put your purpose into action and help build a future that works for everyone, everywhere—as a Kearney Original.




Key responsibilities

Leverages analytical and technical skills to process and interpret data from multiple internal and external sources to provide support to HR and other internal teams in understanding firm people statistics.
Works with internal stakeholders to answer data and reporting questions for firm statistics.
Increases self service capabilities of end users by building straightforward meaningful solutions.
Works collaboratively within the People Analytics team and broader R&A function in the development, production, and continuous improvement of existing and new reports.
Understand, identify, locate, and extract data from a variety of sources for use in analysis.
Maintain data feeds that support Power Bi dashboards.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal clients.




Who you are

After nearly 100 years, we know this business is fundamentally about making connections—between facts, figures, insights, strategies, tools, technologies, and above all, people. That’s why we look for collaborative, insightful, and inquisitive problem-solvers who don’t accept the first thing in front of them and who are always unapologetically themselves.




We want to hear from you if you are:




Ready to share your ideas and contribute as soon as you join a team
Analytically inclined and enjoy solving problems
Able to prioritize and are a doer by nature
3-5 years of relevant work experience
Possess an undergraduate degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field is preferred
Fluent in English
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Proficient with PowerBI
Experienced with HR information systems (PeopleSoft preferred)




What we can offer you

Every day, our people work to be the difference for our clients, our communities, and our colleagues. Helping them make an impact, they are sustained by a competitive remuneration package plus comprehensive benefits and perks, including but not limited to:




Generous retirement/pension savings contributions
Comprehensive medical insurance for employees and their families
Non-partner equity-based awards (for consulting managers and above)
Structured and on-the-job learning and development opportunities
Personalized opportunities including talent mobility, flexible work programs and externships to help you chart a unique career journey to pursue your own personal and professional goals




Equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination

Kearney prides itself on providing a culture where our employees belong and thrive equally, which means our people feel comfort, confidence, and joy as they do great things for our firm, our colleagues, and our clients. That’s why Kearney is committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive environment. Kearney is an equal opportunity employer; we recruit, hire, train, promote, develop, and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race or ethnicity, religion, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other differences consistent with applicable laws. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for disabilities or religious beliefs and practices. We encourage everyone to apply, including those who may not feel historically represented in consulting.

Show more
HTML:
As a People Data Analyst at Kearney, you will support the global HR programs and initiatives by creating tools and presenting data in a manner that educates, informs, and influences the decisions of HR clients and business leaders. This role works closely with the Global Compensation team in Chicago, but also collaborates with Talent Management, HR, Digital HR, and finance teams globally.


Working alongside a dedicated and diverse set of people, you will broaden your knowledge and experience in an open, agile, and collaborative environment. With the freedom to be yourself and recognition for what you bring to the table, you can put your purpose into action and help build a future that works for everyone, everywhere—as a Kearney Original.


Key responsibilities

  • Leverages analytical and technical skills to process and interpret data from multiple internal and external sources to provide support to HR and other internal teams in understanding firm people statistics.
  • Works with internal stakeholders to answer data and reporting questions for firm statistics.
  • Increases self service capabilities of end users by building straightforward meaningful solutions.
  • Works collaboratively within the People Analytics team and broader R&A function in the development, production, and continuous improvement of existing and new reports.
  • Understand, identify, locate, and extract data from a variety of sources for use in analysis.
  • Maintain data feeds that support Power Bi dashboards.
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal clients.


Who you are

After nearly 100 years, we know this business is fundamentally about making connections—between facts, figures, insights, strategies, tools, technologies, and above all, people. That’s why we look for collaborative, insightful, and inquisitive problem-solvers who don’t accept the first thing in front of them and who are always unapologetically themselves.


We want to hear from you if you are:


  • Ready to share your ideas and contribute as soon as you join a team
  • Analytically inclined and enjoy solving problems
  • Able to prioritize and are a doer by nature
  • 3-5 years of relevant work experience
  • Possess an undergraduate degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field is preferred
  • Fluent in English
  • Proficient with Microsoft Excel
  • Proficient with PowerBI
  • Experienced with HR information systems (PeopleSoft preferred)


What we can offer you

Every day, our people work to be the difference for our clients, our communities, and our colleagues. Helping them make an impact, they are sustained by a competitive remuneration package plus comprehensive benefits and perks, including but not limited to:


  • Generous retirement/pension savings contributions
  • Comprehensive medical insurance for employees and their families
  • Non-partner equity-based awards (for consulting managers and above)
  • Structured and on-the-job learning and development opportunities
  • Personalized opportunities including talent mobility, flexible work programs and externships to help you chart a unique career journey to pursue your own personal and professional goals


Equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination

Kearney prides itself on providing a culture where our employees belong and thrive equally, which means our people feel comfort, confidence, and joy as they do great things for our firm, our colleagues, and our clients. That’s why Kearney is committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive environment. Kearney is an equal opportunity employer; we recruit, hire, train, promote, develop, and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race or ethnicity, religion, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other differences consistent with applicable laws. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for disabilities or religious beliefs and practices. We encourage everyone to apply, including those who may not feel historically represented in consulting.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Irving, TX/ Jersey City, NJ/ Tampa, FL/ Jacksonville, FL (Onsite)

Duration: FTE

8+ Years of Experience.

Job Description:

Key Skills: ETL, SQL, Data warehouse, Data Analyst
Hands-on experience on Data Analyst role preferable with BFSI domain
ETL, Power BI, SAS, SQL, Tableau, Excel Pivot or some sort of analytical tool reporting experience is good to have

Responsibilities:

Provide analytical perspectives to the business throughout the SDLC process
Analyze and test effort for complex projects spanning multiple business to technology areas
Understand the current data processing and management across various operational processes
Work on the data issues identified for Business and Technology processes as part of the DCRM work.
Consolidation of existing artifacts like Data Models, metadata, DQ practices, Mast & Ref data use cases, Lineage, issues, etc. across each data flow cluster.
Determine and document gaps in the above artifacts.
Identify gaps in the data assets. Create a remediation plan to bridge the gap.
Analyze the data services used in the various application services. Analyze data elements within the data services.
Assist in root cause analysis for the issues identified. Determine and document gaps in these artifacts.
Act as liaison between business function stakeholders and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and validate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




The Data Analyst will work within the PMO of Division, and Practice Program Management team to develop reports dashboards to equip President and SVP with information necessary for contract compliance, planning and forecasting of resources. This position involves collecting, processing, and performing statistical analyses on large datasets to identify trends and patterns. This role is highly collaborative and serves as a communication agent, engaging with coding teams, leadership, and the client to ensure client satisfaction with project delivery. This role is onsite and based in either our Franklin, Tennessee or Jacksonville, Florida office.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyzes needs of data with SME’s and determines appropriate tools for capture and display
Participates in planning for new technology needs for practice
Gathers and maintains data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Analyzes complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends. Utilize statistical tools and techniques to interpret data.
Creates and presents comprehensive reports and dashboards that summarize findings and provide recommendations to stakeholders.
Develops visual representations of data, including charts, graphs, and dashboards, to communicate findings effectively.
Works closely with other departments to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Ensures the integrity of data by performing regular audits and data validation checks.
Identifies and resolves data-related issues and inconsistencies.
Stays up to date with industry trends and best practices to enhance data analysis processes.
Fosters a collaborative environment to promote knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
Provides administrative support as needed.
Explores operational improvements and collaborate with operational teams to design and implement.
Works closely with the leadership team to identify operational trends to drive continuous improvement.




Qualifications:

In-depth knowledge of network security principles, technologies, and best practices.
Experience with data analysis, reporting, and project management.
Adaptable and highly agile-must be comfortable being a doer and a facilitator depending on focus for the project.
Experience building dashboards.
Knowledge of SQL and ability to create complex ad-hoc statements involving large datasets.
Reporting experience, preferably with Crystal Reports, or other technologies that interface with databases.
Proficiency with MS Excel, including VLOOKUP and Pivot tables.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong organization skills; able to keep track of high-volume tasks.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and clients, establishing and maintaining effective working relationships.
Ability to be flexible and adaptable to an ever-changing environment.
Comfortable with prioritization and competing deadlines.
Superior analytical skills and can research solutions and make recommendations.
Confidently develops plans to meet goals and can articulate team roles in achieving them.
Ability to see the big picture and think broader to advance project goals.
Strong time management skills.
Ability to drive tasks forward to completion.
Applicant Tracking System knowledge preferred (Bullhorn a plus).
Demonstrates resiliency, shows initiative, driven, persistent.
Ability to handle competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated with an ability to work independently.
Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) with advanced Excel skills.




Education & Certification:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.

Experience with data analysis tools and techniques.

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.




Aside from a benefits package that is a cut above the rest, you will gain access to an award-winning company culture. Want to see for yourself?




With CSI, you will gain access to….

Healthcare coverage plus HSA matching
Fitness challenges with incentives & rewards for participation
Participation in 401(k) retirement plan
Competitive compensation plan
Volunteer opportunities through our very own non-profit organization CSI Gives Back
An award-winning corporate culture




The CSI Companies provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL/Tableau/Visualizations/Hive (Hybrid in Fremont, CA)
Description:
Job Description




iTalent Digital is seeking a Data Analyst to join our BI, Data & Analytics practice. 90% of your work will be client focused. 10% of your work will be internal. This role offers an exciting opportunity within one of our esteemed technology and social media clients, focusing on supporting dynamic engagements in the realm of Facilities and Culinary operations.




The role primarily involves creating and maintaining analytics products, reporting, and analytical tasks within the context of Facilities and Culinary operations. The ideal candidate will demonstrate proficiency in Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis, particularly in SQL, Hive, and Tableau, navigating complex data environments and driving BI-centric priorities within these domains.




This position is based in Fremont, CA. We provide comprehensive medical benefits, a 401k plan, paid holidays, and more. Please note that we are only considering direct W2 candidates at this time, as we are unable to offer sponsorship.




This role requires you to work in office in Fremont, CA 3x a week!




Responsibilities:




Create and maintain analytics products to support Facilities and Culinary operations. Support enhancements of existing products and drive efforts to improve efficiencies.
Develop a thorough understanding of spatial, financial, and behavioral data in areas such as Facilities and On-campus services.
Write queries to analyze data and combine disparate sources.
Build dashboards and visualizations for a wide range of operational and executive audiences. Translate requirements into dashboard designs that are informative, polished, and concise.
Utilize your knowledge of the data to answer stakeholder questions with the right sources. Work with urgency on time-sensitive matters without compromising accuracy.
Respond to data quality issues by identifying root causes and proposing solutions with minimal guidance.
Clearly articulate issues, enhancements, and related impacts to both technical teams (data engineering) and non-technical business partners.
Support various cross-functional teams within the Facilities & Culinary division, including:
Culinary Team: Manage day-to-day operations, purchasing, planning spend, and overseeing the number of people fed.
Design Team: Assist in the design and programming of meeting rooms and amenities spaces.
Space Planning Team: Manage occupancy, desk assignments, moving teams, and working on business strategy.
Technical Space Team: Support labs, lab standards, and lab usage.
Transportation Team: Aid in shuttle services, other transportation needs, capacity planning, and commute analysis.




The internal responsibilities will be as follows:

Attend regular internal practice community meetings.
Collaborate with your iTD practice team on industry thought leadership.
Complete client case studies and learning material. (Blogs, media material).
Build out material to contribute to Digital Transformation practice.
Attend internal iTD networking events (in person and virtual).
Work with leadership on career fast-track opportunities.




Required qualifications and skills

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.
4+ years of experience managing, analyzing, and reporting on large data sets.
Strong proficiency in SQL.
Experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards with advanced capabilities such as LOD calculations, data blending/joins, window functions, and parameters.
Fluency in Excel to perform analysis and summarize data into a presentable format.
Experience managing and analyzing data using Hive tables for efficient processing and insightful analysis.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team player.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate complex issues in a clear, concise manner.
Ability to learn, operate, and troubleshoot independently.
Keen attention to detail in the context of numbers (data fidelity) as well as design (dashboard presentation).




Preferred qualifications and skills

Proficiency in developing ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages like Python or R.
Experience in Business Operations, Finance, People Analytics, or Product Analytics.
Experience in addressing data quality issues and translating vague technical issues to non-technical terms.
Ability to work effectively in a hybrid model with in-person attendance required 3 days a week in Fremont, CA.

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.




Company description

About iTalent Digital:

We are part of a new generation of consulting and software development company that blends diversity, innovation, and integrity with real business results. Our structure rejects any strong hierarchy, empowering us to deliver excellent results. We are a woman- and minority-led firm. Every day, we challenge ourselves to be considerate, fair and to re-think what great outcomes mean for our customers. This permeates down to how we approach every interaction, on every project, for every client. You’ll thrive here if you are a dynamic self-starter, a difference-maker or someone who wants to deliver great results, without constraints.

The iTalent Digital Experience:​

Joining us means you’ll be part of our global community, you have a say about your own career journey, and you’ll get a chance to give back to causes that matter. You will experience working with Fortune 500 companies and high-performance teams across numerous industries.

iTalent Digital offers our employees excellent benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays, PTO, 401K + matching, networking & career learning and development programs. We are growing and we want to see you grow!​

​

Visit https://www.italentdigital.com/careers to learn more about what working at iTalent can mean for you.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

iTalent is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact us at recruiting@italentdigital.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Additional info

Dynamic environment in a culture of respect, empowerment and recognition for a job well done, apply today!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




The successful candidate will work closely with divisions across our organization and the group to provide actionable insights and make data-driven decisions.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Collaborate with key stakeholders across divisions, ETO, and the group to capture business requirements and translate them into technical needs.
Develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques, providing ongoing reports.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and clean data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Maintain data security and confidentiality in all tasks.
Communicate effectively with various stakeholders at different levels within the organization, presenting findings and making recommendations.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.
Have a deep understanding of systems and data architecture, design, and integrations.
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks), and reporting packages (Business Objects, Power BI, etc.).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Job Location: Savannah GA 31406

Onsite Requirements:

Running SQL queries to pull data from Snowflake
Build reporting from data using Qlik
Strong understanding of business metrics/KPIs

Job Description:

Essential Functions / Duties Performed Regularly:

Analyze and interpret data from various marketing campaigns to uncover trends, patterns, and insights related to performance and identify areas for improvement.
Monitor and evaluate call center metrics, such as call volumes, service levels, customer satisfaction, and resolution times.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track key performance indicators (KPIs) and marketing effectiveness.
Collaborate with marketing teams to design and implement A/B testing frameworks and measure the impact of various campaigns.
Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize marketing spend and improve return on investment (ROI).
Work with customer service managers to improve call center operations and customer engagement strategies.
Utilize advanced analytics techniques to forecast trends and model potential outcomes of marketing and customer service initiatives.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in analytics and performance marketing tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Work Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within a marketing or advertising context.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
Statistical Knowledge: Proficiency in statistical tests, distributions, and regression analysis.
Data Visualization: Skill in creating clear visual representations of data using tools like Tableau or Power BI.
SQL: Strong command of SQL for querying databases.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in programming languages - SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools.
Machine Learning: Understanding of basic machine learning algorithms and their application in marketing data.
A/B Testing: Experience in designing and interpreting A/B tests to optimize campaign performance.
Data Mining: Ability to extract data from various sources and prepare it for analysis
Strong communication skills: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Physical Requirements:

Standing, walking, sitting, movement and use of mechanical controls, such as keyboard, are frequently required.

** 3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.

This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future **

Job Description:

Essential Functions / Duties Performed Regularly:

  • Analyze and interpret data from various marketing campaigns to uncover trends, patterns, and insights related to performance and identify areas for improvement.
  • Monitor and evaluate call center metrics, such as call volumes, service levels, customer satisfaction, and resolution times.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track key performance indicators (KPIs) and marketing effectiveness.
  • Collaborate with marketing teams to design and implement A/B testing frameworks and measure the impact of various campaigns.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize marketing spend and improve return on investment (ROI).
  • Work with customer service managers to improve call center operations and customer engagement strategies.
  • Utilize advanced analytics techniques to forecast trends and model potential outcomes of marketing and customer service initiatives.
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in analytics and performance marketing tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Work Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within a marketing or advertising context.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
  • Statistical Knowledge: Proficiency in statistical tests, distributions, and regression analysis.
  • Data Visualization: Skill in creating clear visual representations of data using tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • SQL: Strong command of SQL for querying databases.
  • Programming Languages: Proficiency in programming languages - SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools.
  • Machine Learning: Understanding of basic machine learning algorithms and their application in marketing data.
  • A/B Testing: Experience in designing and interpreting A/B tests to optimize campaign performance.
  • Data Mining: Ability to extract data from various sources and prepare it for analysis
  • Strong communication skills: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Physical Requirements:

  • Standing, walking, sitting, movement and use of mechanical controls, such as keyboard, are frequently required.

** 3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.

This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future **

Title: Analista de Datos Jr
Description:
Descripción Del Puesto

Estamos en búsqueda de un(a) Analista de Datos Junior para unirse a nuestro equipo. La persona seleccionada será responsable de la recopilación, revisión y análisis de datos, así como del apoyo en la gestión de inventarios y materiales. Esta es una excelente oportunidad para aquellos que tienen afinidad con los números y desean desarrollarse en el campo del análisis de datos.

Requisitos

Edad: Entre 20 y 35 años.

Formación Académica: Carreras afines a las matemáticas, ingeniería, ciencia de datos, estadística, economía o cualquier perfil relacionado con el análisis numérico.Experiencia: No se requiere experiencia previa. Buscamos candidatos que sean aprendices o juniors. También consideramos becarios que tengan el deseo de aprender y desarrollarse en el área.

Habilidades


Afinidad con los números y el análisis de datos.
Capacidad para manejar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Atención al detalle y habilidades analíticas.
Proactividad y deseo de aprendizaje continuo.


Responsabilidades


Recopilación y análisis de datos.
Revisión y gestión de materiales.
Apoyo en la elaboración de informes y reportes analíticos.
Colaboración con otros departamentos para la implementación de estrategias basadas en datos.


Ofrecemos


Capacitación y desarrollo continuo.
Oportunidades de crecimiento dentro de la empresa.
Un ambiente de trabajo dinámico y colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Bullets


Extract and manipulate data to reveal complex data relationships
Conduct data exploration to understand relationships in client data systems
Create data flows and other documentation to communicate results of data analyses
Document data mapping and data translation rules
Document data analytic and dashboarding practices


Job Description

The Data Analyst is responsible for mapping datasets, analyzing datasets, and documenting/troubleshooting any difficulties in creating database entity relationships. Responsibilities of this role include coordinating data requirements and documenting data mapping and data translation rules. Data analysts will work with the Business Analyst to ensure that analytics, dashboards, and reports clearly deliver insight to business stakeholders.

Qualifications


Excellent analytical skills to not only extract and manipulate data, but also understand and interpret complex data and data issues, and then communicate those results with recommendations
Ability to understand complex database design/structure with limited documentation.
Strong technical proficiency with SQL and related technologies
Demonstrated technical proficiency in Tableau, PowerBI, or other dashboarding tools favored by the client
Experience with Sagemaker Data Analytics and other AWS-based data analytic tools
Experience and understanding in business intelligence and real-time analytics


Common Optional Qualifications


Experience with non-relational, NoSQL databases and various data-storage systems
Experience moving data within cloud-based environments


Skills: data analytics,aws,nosql,tableau

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The DBI team specializes in the evaluation of damaged structures. DBI’s construction experts provide independent recommendations and analysis to clients in the insurance and legal industry. Hard evidence, expertise, and accuracy drive work; communication and connection are the company’s top priorities. In a complex industry, the company’s mission is to bring clarity to every client served by DBI.




The Data Analyst will work act as the subject matter expert (SME) on report writing, report visualization, data requests, and owning complex data projects. The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating and maintaining dashboards, as well as testing custom created platforms and troubleshooting.




PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Design and implement new reporting and dashboards to assist teams’ ability to perform their job and to provide actionable insights in a scalable and sustainable way.
Maintain and oversee all existing dashboards and reports.
Optimize and troubleshoot reports and dashboards for performance, quality, and data integrity. Work with external developer when necessary.
Provide support to team to ensure availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards.
Write reports utilizing data visualizations and dashboards derived from a large volume of data, ensuring accuracy and precision, reconciling data to ensure accuracy in all tasks.
Act as subject matter expert of company’s available datasets, spanning a range of data and data types.
Perform audit in production to ensure data is accurate and identify areas that require quality control.
Run ad-hoc data requests.
Identify areas to improve overall efficiency and data integrity, across departments.
Continually improve and augment reporting; increase reporting as new data becomes available.
Be agile in learning new skills and technologies as required for the role.
Perform duties with low supervision, taking initiative to accomplish team objectives/goals.
Uphold the values of DBI Construction Consultants and the culture espoused by Our Foundation.
Consistently demonstrates professionalism, integrity and the highest standards of ethical behavior and professional conduct; conducts oneself in a manner that reflects favorably on the organization.
Maintain the confidentiality of proprietary and sensitive information, exercising sound judgment and discretion in any disclosure of information related to DBI Construction Consultants and its endeavors.
Commits to continuous improvement and professional development for self and team members.
Perform all other duties as assigned.




REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

A bachelor’s degree in computer science, or relevant data technology field.
Three (3) Years of relevant work experience in software development, database, analytical tools, and report writing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues independently.
Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with users at all levels of the organization.
Ability to work under pressure, independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities simultaneously.




SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Experience creating dashboards and self-service capabilities for stakeholders through reporting tools (Power Bi, etc.).
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics and differentiate between correlation and causation.
Proven understanding of python, especially libraries and packages focused on data processing, as well as analysis.
Proficient in PowerBI, SharePoint, and Microsoft Office with ability to use Excel's advanced functions.
Experience in DevExpress, SQL and distributed files systems, as well as using multiple data sources.
Demonstrated project or work experience using one more programming/scripting languages.
Ability to recognize opportunities for process improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions.
Analytical ability for data gathering, transformation, and complex analysis.
Eagerness to learn, well-organized, and detail oriented.
Navigate large datasets and work with multiple data sets and sources.
Ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to diverse collaborators.




WORKING CONDITIONS:

Work is conducted primarily in an indoor office environment with protection from weather conditions and with exposure to noise typical of an office or administrative setting.







PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS:

Work requires light lifting (10 – 15 lbs.), standing, walking, stooping, kneeling, reaching, fingering (keyboarding) and repetitive hand motion, grasping, talking, and hearing at normal speaking levels. Work requires visual acuity to read and prepare data and figures, transcribe words and numbers, view information on a computer terminal, read, operate office machines, and determine the accuracy and thoroughness of work.




The Data Analyst is required to work in the DBI New York or Atlanta office from 9:00AM - 6:00PM ET in order to accommodate occasional meetings and work activities.




Salary: 72K+

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are




Aucta Pharmaceuticals is an emerging product development pharmaceutical company. Aucta is implementing a branded/generic hybrid model, generating both near-term product revenue and mid/long-term investment return. We aim to become a significant specialty pharmaceutical company in the U.S. marketplace integrating R&D, manufacturing, and commercialization. We focus on improved dosage forms for patients with a therapeutic focus in CNS, and select orphan drug disease states.




Aucta successfully launched its first branded product, Motpoly XR, in the epilepsy space with a targeted sales force in mid-February 2024. We are now expanding our commercial presence in the neurology/epilepsy sector by increasing our field sales territories to 20. Our objective is to enhance our marketing, managed care, and sales capabilities to support future pipeline products in neurology over the coming years.

Position Description




The Pharmaceutical Data Analyst is an integral part of the commercial team, tasked with managing all commercial performance metrics including prescription-level data (by healthcare provider, channel, payer, formulary), sales, and rebate calculations to produce comprehensive materials and reports to facilitate decision-making across the organization. This role is pivotal in analyzing sales data, forecasting revenues, and managing managed care rebate programs critical to our business operations. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical proficiency in advanced Microsoft Excel, SQL, and Power BI, combined with a solid background in sales forecasting and rebate analysis within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.




This is a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment, requiring a sense of urgency, hunger to succeed, and an altruistic approach to the business. You will report to the Associate Director of Corporate Development.




This role is in the office 5 days per week.




Primary Responsibilities for this Role:

Utilize advanced Excel functions and data modeling techniques to analyze sales data and trends.
Guide and manage SQL queries to extract and manipulate large datasets from various sources.
Create insightful reports and dashboards using Power BI to visualize sales performance metrics and rebate program effectiveness.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, and Managed Care to understand business requirements and provide data-driven insights.
Conduct detailed analysis of managed care contracts and rebate agreements to ensure compliance and accuracy.
Support the leadership team in forecasting sales revenues and monitoring financial performance against targets.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation to streamline data management and reporting processes.
Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes affecting managed care rebate programs.
Participate in internal meetings with broader sales and leadership team.




Required Qualifications for this Role:




Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience (minimum of 4 to 6 years) in sales data analysis, sales forecasting, and rebate analysis, preferably in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including VBA/macros), SQL, and Power BI for data analysis and reporting is required.
Experience with managed care rebate programs and understanding of healthcare reimbursement methodologies is highly desirable.
Oversee the development, preparation and presentation of accurate and robust reports, dashboards, and KPIs related to GTN performance, market access insights, and reimbursement trends.
Ensures a culture of engagement with a clear vision for success. Can take complex strategy and direction and ensure team understanding.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented and organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively.
Team player with a proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving.
Must be able to travel and participate during plan of action meetings as needed. At times required travel may be up to 10%-20%.




Work Location:

This position is based at our Piscataway, NJ site and will transition to our new Basking Ridge, NJ location in early 2025. This is an office-based role, requiring presence 5 days a week. The selected candidate must be able to commute to both Piscataway and Basking Ridge, NJ

Salary Range

Aucta Pharmaceuticals considers a combination of the candidate’s education, training, experience, location, external market, and internal value when determining a salary level for potential new employees where you can use your experiences, perspectives, and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Base Salary: $100,000-$130,000 per year; commensurate with experience

Bonus Incentive: 12%




Benefits

We offer a competitive benefits package to all employees, including:

Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
401k
Life Insurance
Disability
PTO




Aucta Pharmaceuticals is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Please refrain from forwarding unsolicited resumes from agencies to Aucta Pharmaceuticals. Aucta is not liable for any fees incurred from the use of resumes from this source. We only compensate agencies with whom we have a formal agreement. For recruitment inquiries, please reach out directly to our Human Resources department.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Oshawa (Onsite)

Working hours: 3rd shift role, about 22:30-6:30- can vary by an hour or so.




Our Automotive client is looking to fill a “Control Room Analyst” position within Global Supply Chain, on the Production Control Team working out of Oshawa Assembly location. The Control Room Analyst monitors and analyzes order flow through assembly plant and serves as primary point of contact for a variety of plant floor requests and issues related to production processes and information control systems. Work is primarily in an office environment and shift work is required.




Job Description:

Monitor production GEPICS (global enterprise information control system) and ensure optimal performance
Troubleshooting and providing technical support to production and 3rd party organizations as needed
Provide training and administrative support to users of production information control system
Responsible for running batch jobs to sequence vehicle orders, perform vehicle build data updates
Maintain, monitor batch jobs in mainframe and production information control systems
Create, update, and maintain system reporting and documentation
Verify, report out daily production numbers
Track expedited orders through assembly
Coordinate and execute 3rd party vendor disaster recovery procedures
Perform print quality inspection, information verification, sequence order verification of all VINS
Reprint labels, documents as necessary due to quality issues or plant request
Enforce, adhere to strict security procedures related to handling and distribution of VIN labels

Candidate requirements:

Computer literacy
Experience working with GM systems (GEPICS, MGO, Cimplicity)
Process oriented with focus on continuous improvement
Supply chain experience
Problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to work under pressure
Extreme attention to detail
Quick learner, able to adapt quickly in production critical manufacturing environment.
Effective communication skills, ability to communicate with all levels of the organization

  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Extreme attention to detail
  • Quick learner, able to adapt quickly in production critical manufacturing environment.
  • Effective communication skills, ability to communicate with all levels of the organization

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Location: 10250 Constellation Blvd., Century City, Los Angeles, US (3 days in the office-hybrid)




About This Role

BIGO LIVE is seeking a talented, curious Business Intelligence Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product, engineering, and operations. The team is data-driven and results-focused. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical, analytical, and operations background – with a hunger to make our platform grow. This position is full-time and is located at our Los Angeles office.




Responsibilities

Independently own internal team data using SQL, Python, Excel and provide ongoing reporting
Create and manage data pipelines in Excel, SQL or Python to aggregate data for different operations team
Build, maintain and provide data for the internal operations teams, interact with internal users to establish and clarify requirements in order to develop report specifications
Ensure the KPI & metrics are aligned across the different business functions in the operations team
Advise leaders and support decisions for launches of in-app initiatives
Understand ecosystems, behaviors, and long-term trends of live-stream content




Qualifications

BA or BS degree in a quantitative field: data science, finance, information systems, mathematics, statistics or similar
At least 3 years of analyst experience (combination of technical and practical experience i.e. finding insights and presenting to leaders), preferred 5
Experience using SQL, Excel(spreadsheets), and at least one scripting language such as Python, R, javascript, etc.
Proficient in converting data sets into actionable business insights
Experience presenting reports and analyses to a non-technical audience
Experience with navigating ambiguity through data-driven decision-making and adaptable to fast-paced environment
Great communication and teamwork skills




Benefits

Competitive pay package that includes a base salary and performance-related bonus
Generous paid time off starting at 4 weeks + 10 sick days and 9 Holidays per year
Free medical, dental, and vision insurance
401k
Free gym membership

Title: Data Analyst-Contract Temp
Description:
About The Role

10x Genomics is seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Project Engineering team. The ideal candidate will have strong organization and communication skills, a strong work ethic, and the ability to collect and compile data and assist in the coordination of project execution. As a Program Coordinator, you will play a critical role in gathering and compiling data, enabling our teams to make data-driven decisions about COGS optimization initiatives.

What You Will Be Doing


Collect and analyze data to support ROI analyses of potential COGS optimization activities.
Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g., finance, procurement, planning, NPD, R&D, and Product Management) to gather relevant project-related data.
Maintain and update COGS / ROI models within the Project Engineering data infrastructure.
Provide programmatic and organization support for the Director of Project Engineering, and project technical leads.
Create reports and dashboards to facilitate the monitoring of project status and impact, and report out results to Senior Management and other stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data verification and cleaning measures, so as to ensure that the fidelity and robustness of datasets and models is adequate to support consequential business decisions.


Minimum Requirements


BS in Business or a technical or semi-technical field with 1+ years of experience either in a full time role or an internship.
Proficiency with basic data analysis tools such as Google Sheets or Excel.
Ability to work independently within a framework of guidance and specified deliverables.
Some experience with basic financial analysis and terms, though expertise in these areas is not required.
High level of attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment.


Preferred Qualifications And Skills


Experience working in a technical environment such as a semiconductor, biotech or life sciences company.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).


#on-site

About 10x Genomics

At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It is a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.

We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they did not even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across biology including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.

Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented people driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists and clinicians to make new strides. We are dedicated to finding the very best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.

Individuals seeking employment at 10x Genomics are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

10x does not accept unsolicited applicants submitted by third-party recruiters or agencies. Any resume or application submitted to 10x without a vendor agreement in place will be considered unsolicited and property of 10x, and 10x will not pay a placement fee.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Primary Location: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

V-Soft Consulting is currently hiring for a Data Analyst II for our premier client in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Education And Experience »

Minimum 2 years of experience.
Basic Python scripting/Data manipulation; we use python to map visualizations and most of the python work will already be documented. Need to be able to read the code.
Dashboarding with Tableau - top skill (70%).
SQL scripting and querying - top skill.
Looking for someone more on the data analysis side.

What You’ll Do

Job Responsibilities:

Will update dashboards in Tableau and do ad-hoc reporting.
Work with data partners to create data points and work with geospatial data to present maps.
Maintain current data products and create new data points.
Intake and understand if can do what business requests.
There is not a big visualization focus, most dashboard work will be updating what is in place.

Interested?

Qualified candidates should send their resumes to aarava@vsoftconsulting.com




V-Soft Consulting Group is recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America, V-Soft Consulting Group is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations in India, Canada and the U.S. V-Soft is known as an agile, innovative technology services company holding several awards and distinctions and has a wide variety of partnerships across diverse technology stacks.

As a valued V-Soft Consultant, you’re eligible for full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision), a 401(k) plan, competitive compensation and more. V-Soft is partnered with numerous Fortune 500 companies, exceptionally positioned to advance your career growth.

V-Soft Consulting provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

For more information or to view all our open jobs, please visit www.vsoftconsulting.com or call (844) 425-8425.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Remote

Job Posting Title: Data Analyst: II (Intermediate) - Snowflake SQL & WMS

Description: This job will run for 6 months

• This req is an immediate need, please send resumes as soon as you can.

• This role is also ONLY contract and will not have the opportunity for contract to hire. It will be at least 6 months in length.

• Management experience is not necessary.

• The core requirements are:

• Advanced to Expert SQL coding skills for report development (i.e., Snowflake SQL)

• Experience with order management systems (OMS) testing and supporting analytics

• Strong analytical skills when working with large sets of data

• Experience with report creation - taking business requirements and developing reports based off of business needs

• Self-motivated and driven

• Able to thrive in environments that are ever evolving and changing based on business needs (if require structured and set processes and procedures, this is not the position for you)

• Strong independent problem solving skills

SUMMARY:

This role will be housed within the Inventory Hub Management (IHM) team, with a focus on inventory data mining and reporting in relation to order management systems (OMS) and warehouse management systems (WMS). This role will be responsible for taking business requirements and developing SQL based reports for business and technical team use. These reports will assist with day-to-day inventory management as well as OMS system pre- and post-implementation testing and monitoring. The focus OMS system management by the IHM is Manhattan Active Omni (MAO). This associate will play a key role in implementing the MAO system and will oversee IHM system reporting related to omni-channel inventory visibility and order fulfillment. This position calls for someone who has direct experience in this area, as well as proven experience in SQL coding.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Manage requirement capture and development of new Inventory Hub and Manhattan Active Order Management (MAO) system reporting

• Responsible for managing omni-channel daily, weekly, and ad hoc inventory availability and order fulfillment reporting

• Define and develop KPIs for omni-channel inventory sharing and order fulfillment performance tracking based on analytic findings

• Perform analysis and make recommendations to drive optimization of inventory visibility/sharing and omni-channel order fulfillment

• Potential for OMS system testing for phased MAO and MAO-impacting system implementations




KEY SKILLS / ATTRIBUTES:

• Robust problem-solving skills, time management skills and ability to multitask efficiently

• Strong work ethic, ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment

• Ability to thrive in ever evolving and changing environments, where duties are flexed based on business/project needs

• Substantial capacity for following through tasks to completion in line with defined due dates

• Able to work effectively with all levels of the organizations

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Results and actions oriented; approaches challenges and projects with perseverance




EDUCATION / BACKGROUND:

• Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business management, data analytics, computer science, finance or other relative studies from a four-year university

• Preferred a minimum of 4+ years in inventory control/management, data analytics, accounting, or audit

• Manhattan Active Omni system experience is a plus

• Oracle Retail Systems experience is a plus

• Snowflake query development experience is a plus

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
Our client is looking for a Data and BI Analyst II to be a key member of our Business Intelligence and Analytics team. The successful candidate will build and maintain strong relationships with business partners, while supporting the company’s analytic capabilities and ensuring delivery of high-quality analytic solutions. This role requires the person be an experienced leader with deep hands on experience in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and customer analytics.




The pay rate range for this is $90,000-$110,000. Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Aya Healthcare, winner of multiple Top Workplace awards!

We’re looking for an excited contributor to our Data Operations team – working closely with DBAs, Data Engineers and other technology teams, this person will help transform information about our apps and technologies into usable information for the business. Working in Power BI, this team works to provide data-driven strategies to department and project heads that have the potential to take technology development to the next level. This role is a part of a small, nimble, team working in a fast-paced environment for a great company where your opinion and experience matters. We have grown seemingly exponentially in the last couple of years and now have a need to dedicate a significant resource to these efforts.

Who We Are:

We’re a $10+ billion, rapidly growing workforce solutions provider in the healthcare industry. We deliver tech-enabled services that help healthcare organizations meet and manage their contingent labor needs. We build and manage tech-enabled marketplaces for national and local healthcare talent and deliver contingent labor management solutions through our proprietary software platform.

At Aya, we’re obsessed with creating exceptional experiences for our clients, clinicians and employees. In fact, we put employee satisfaction above all else. Our team members are responsible for incomparable customer experience and we know that happy employees are critical to maintaining happy clients. We foster an entrepreneurial, high-energy, low-bureaucracy culture and value innovative thinking and creative problem solving. We embrace diversity in thought and backgrounds unified by a commitment to high achievement. When you join Aya, you’ll be surrounded by teammates who care about you as an individual and leaders who will help you grow both personally and professionally.

Responsibilities:


Technology is constantly changing, so we need quick and innovative individuals to partner with the technology team. Using data from the applications and third-party resources, they will suggest data-driven strategies that will drive technology developments and tuning.
Be a resource for what other data sources should be added to the data lake and how that information will help the technology team get bigger, faster and better.
Provide data visualizations that will show them how the applications are being used and provide strategies for increasing use and functionality.
Using PowerBI, develop reports, visualizations, and custom extracts for the technology team to monitor the effectiveness of the strategies provided.
Understand database relationships and interconnections among data sources.
Develop work plans, timelines and manage workflows to meet timeframes.
Explore the data and discover patterns, meaningful relationships, anomalies and trends.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree required.
Skills in SQL, Python or R required.
Experience with PowerBI or similar data visualization tool.
Experience managing large projects.
Experience working with relational databases.
Experience with data administration, design, and architecture.
Ability to articulate complex concepts, thought leadership and the business value of solutions in a clear and understandable way.


What We Offer:


Free premium medical, dental, life and vision insurance 
Generous 401(k) match 
Aya also offers other benefits to those that are eligible and where required by applicable law, including reimbursements and discretionary bonuses 
Aya provides paid sick leave in accordance with all applicable state, federal, and local laws. Aya’s general sick leave policy is that employees accrue one hour of paid sick leave for every 30 hours worked. However, to the extent any provisions of the statement above conflict with any applicable paid sick leave laws, the applicable paid sick leave laws are controlling 
Celebrations! We hit our goals and reward ourselves.  
Company-sponsored virtual events, happy hours and team-building activities are always on the horizon — plus, you get a special treat on your birthday! 
Unlimited DTO — we believe in time off!  
Virtual yoga, meditation or boot camp classes offered daily 


Compensation: Aya reasonably anticipates the pay scale for this position to be $40.87 to $52.88 hourly, which equates to $85,000 to $110,000 annually.

The pay scale for this position may vary if applicant possesses experience outside of what Aya reasonably anticipates for this position. Bonuses are subject to the role and your manager’s discretion. 

Aya is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO), including Disability / Vets, and welcomes all to apply. Please click here for our EEO policy.
