HTML:
Depuis plus de 20 ans, le Groupe Talan conseille les entreprises et les administrations et les accompagne dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation au Luxembourg et à l'étranger.

Avec une présence sur les cinq continents et plus de 5 000 collaborateurs, nous sommes impliqués dans des domaines liés aux mutations technologiques des grands groupes, tels que l'Intelligence Artificielle, le Cloud, Big Data, l'IoT, la Blockchain.

Talan Luxembourg:

Nous sommes une équipe de 160 collaborateurs répartis dans 4 pôles d’expertise : Data Technologies, Cloud & Application Services, Cybersecurity & Infrastructure et Consulting.

Chaque consultant est suivi par un team leader qui exerce le même métier pour les accompagner au mieux dans leur projet de carrière. Nous nous engageons à faire évoluer les compétences de chacun grâce à la formation et organisons des événements d’équipe tout au long de l’année pour cultiver le sentiment d'appartenance.

Bénéficiez d'un lieu de travail adapté à votre situation grâce à nos 3 bureaux à Luxembourg Gare, Bertrange et Emerange.

Job Description

- Concevoir et développer des pipelines ETL pour extraire, transformer et charger les données.
- Créer et optimiser des modèles de données pour répondre aux besoins d'analyse et de reporting.
- Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métier pour comprendre leurs besoins.
- Optimiser les performances des requêtes et des processus ETL.

Qualifications

- 3 ans d’expérience dans l'utilisation d'outils BI.
- Maîtrise d’au moins un ETL ; SQL ; Python.
- Expérience dans la création de visualisations de données.
- Bonne maitrise de l’anglais et du français.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Meetic is the European leader in dating services operating across 21 countries.

As the source of more than 8 million couples, Meetic works to create the best user experience whether online, mobile or at the many events organized every week across Europe.

A company focusing on a human philosophy, supported by the strength of an international group, our teams develop products with a strong social impact.

In recent years, Meetic has placed people and sustainability at the center of its focus through concrete actions: such as a green IT approach (reduction of servers, web eco-design, zero plastic...), friendly work environment, emergency leaves, WFH policy, work-life balance etc…

Take a look at our page: https://www.meetic-europe.com/

The position:

Meetic relies heavily on data to manage its activities, and is constantly developing the use of this asset. In this context, the Data & Analytics team is at the crossroads of key developments.

Our mission is to design tomorrow's dating app to satisfy our millions of monthly users.

Our stack:


Databases : Oracle, PostgreSQL, HDFS
Languages : SQL, Python



We are looking for a Data Analysis intern to join the Meetic Data & Analytics team to help us improve our tools and daily analysis.

Depending on your profile and your start date within the company, you’ll work on:


The daily tasks of a data analyst:
AB test analysis and follow-up with the product managers
Creation of dashboards to monitor KPIs (QlikView).
Ad Hoc analysis to support the different business teams in their decision-making
Analysis tools developed internally:
Continuous improvement (code, adding new features)
Adapting tools to new data sources



Qualifications:


You are a student of an Engineering School and looking for a 5/6 months internship
Possess a strong sensitivity towards data analysis/statistics
You have a good command of SQL or are curious enough to learn it quickly.
You are programming in one or more languages
Working with Excel and Powerpoint doesn't scare you
You're curious, creative, proactive and open-minded
You are a strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment



What we offer:


A responsible and rewarding internship
Operate in an international and multicultural environment
A gorgeous working environment in the heart of Paris, spacious and modern office, rooftop, close to transport and amenities
Edenred lunch vouchers
Use our products free of charge
Enjoy work-life balance



Hiring Process:


A first 30-min Zoom conversation with Guillaume (Recruiter)
A 60-min meeting including a live use case with Marie (Data Analyst)
A final 60-min onsite or Zoom interview with Claire (Data Analytics Director) and Belinda (Sr People Manager)



On your initial days, the HR Team and your team will make sure you start under excellent conditions.

Practical information:

Contract start: As soon as you are ready!

Location: 53 Rue de Châteaudun, Paris 75009

Work From Home Policy: Hybrid, between 2 and 3 days at the office per week required

Contract: 5-6 months internship

Meetic is an employer that respects equal opportunities and diversity

Title: Analista de datos (PowerBI)
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas…




🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸




Somos una empresa internacional con más de 16 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.




Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 5 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Energía, Infraestructuras y Marketing Digital.




Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:




ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL




🕵🏽‍♂️ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍♂️




Al menos 2 años de experiencia en el desarrollo y diseño de soluciones utilizando Power BI.
Experiencia en PowerBI, incluida la creación de informes y cuadros de mando desde cero (mucho énfasis en diseño de los mismos)
Fuerte capacidad para escribir fórmulas DAX avanzadas para cálculos personalizados.
Experiencia en el diseño de modelos de datos eficientes y relaciones entre tablas.
Valorable: conocimiento en Microsoft Fabric o Python
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación en castellano e inglés (mucha comunicación será con clientes internacionales) y capacidad para conceptualizar las necesidades del cliente.




¡Y lo más importante de todo, que realmente estés motivado para un cambio!




🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀




Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos

un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad?




Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura:




· Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado.

· Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día.

· Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad.

· No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial.




¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!!!




¡Te esperamos!

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
Place: Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France
Description:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 à 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?







💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?




Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client







Quelle est t𝐚 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐪𝐮𝐞 Data Analyst 𝐚𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐢𝐧 de la squad Data As A Service 🌟 ?




En tant que Data analyst, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective. Plus largement, tu rejoindras la tribu DATAHUB, en charge de la fabrication de l’offre de services Data des 39 Caisses Régionales.




En intégrant la squad Data As A Service, composée d’une douzaine de collaborateurs et collaboratrices (Product Owner, Scrum master, Data analyst), tu auras un impact majeur sur la bonne utilisation des produits d’aide à décision de la Tribu auprès des Caisses Régionales et sur le respect des bonnes pratiques de fabrication auprès des équipes de développement de CATS.







𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :







🚀 D’assurer le support à une utilisation performante des outils d’aide à la décision pour les Caisses Régionales (Direction stratégique, Back Office, réseau d’agences) :







En étant le contact privilégié des utilisateurs des Caisses Régionales sur le volet des outils décisionnels et sur les données du Système d’information bancaire




En favorisant, par la pédagogie de tes réponses, le quotidien des utilisateurs, et ainsi en contribuant à la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.




En participant à la mesure de la satisfaction des utilisateurs en contribuant à l’élaboration et au dépouillement d’enquêtes.




En favorisant l’autonomie des équipes de développement en Caisse Régionale en leur transmettant les bonnes pratiques.




En mettant à disposition des utilisateurs les outils d’aide à l’utilisation et à la fabrication : les outils de supervision.




En communiquant vers les utilisateurs sur les incidents ou les changements avec interruption de service de nos produits.




En participant aux cellules de résolution des incidents majeurs.







💡 D’être le garant du bon fonctionnement de nos plateformes (plateforme de fabrication et de consommation)







En facilitant la bonne appropriation des normes de développement auprès de l’ensemble des équipes de fabrication de CATS




En validant la performance des tableaux de bord avant leur mise à disposition







🔍 D’évoluer dans un environnement agile stimulant :







En t’appropriant les modèles de données des informations bancaires




En analysant les besoins métiers exprimés par les utilisateurs à travers les incidents ou les assistances




En t’alimentant de l’expertise de la squad, traduite au travers de bases de connaissance, arbres de décision…




En t’inspirant des retours d’expérience à l’occasion des cérémonies AGILE







💻Tu utiliseras toute la palette de tes compétences :




• En nourrissant ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement technique très large : Entrepôts de données sous SQL Server, TERADATA, Outils BI MicroSTrategy, BO Bi4




• Au quotidien, tu utiliseras SQL pour requêter et extraire des données pertinentes à partir de différentes sources de données pour pouvoir disposer des bons éléments.




• Notre environnement de travail est large et les interlocuteurs sont nombreux : Pôle Utilisateurs, autres squads Data & produits, référents CR… la communication et la pédagogie sont la clé !




• En évoluant dans un environnement Agile favorisant l’approche collective dans un cadre SCRUM







Ta Vie au sein de la SQUAD







✅ Une équipe axée sur le service client, la qualité et l’intelligence collective




🤝 Un esprit d’entraide et de collaboration




🤩 De la bonne humeur et des collègues passionnés et passionnants !




🧠 Une équipe pluridisciplinaire en termes de connaissances techniques




🌟 Un environnement de travail favorisant l’amélioration continue des process et des connaissances de l’équipe




🌟 Accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques




👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour t’aider à maximiser ton potentiel







Découvrez le site de Nantes.




𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :




Nous te proposons :

🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.




👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…




👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)




🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)







👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)




🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication




🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)




⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).







𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :




💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.




🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.




👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.




🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.




💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.




💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...




𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?




- Un premier échange avec ton Talent Acquisition Specialist Linda - 1h

- Un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un échange avec Jean-François, ton futur Leader ! - 1h




« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

HTML:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 à 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?



💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?


Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client



Quelle est t𝐚 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐪𝐮𝐞 Data Analyst 𝐚𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐢𝐧 de la squad Data As A Service 🌟 ?


En tant que Data analyst, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective. Plus largement, tu rejoindras la tribu DATAHUB, en charge de la fabrication de l’offre de services Data des 39 Caisses Régionales.


En intégrant la squad Data As A Service, composée d’une douzaine de collaborateurs et collaboratrices (Product Owner, Scrum master, Data analyst), tu auras un impact majeur sur la bonne utilisation des produits d’aide à décision de la Tribu auprès des Caisses Régionales et sur le respect des bonnes pratiques de fabrication auprès des équipes de développement de CATS.



𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :



🚀 D’assurer le support à une utilisation performante des outils d’aide à la décision pour les Caisses Régionales (Direction stratégique, Back Office, réseau d’agences) :



  • En étant le contact privilégié des utilisateurs des Caisses Régionales sur le volet des outils décisionnels et sur les données du Système d’information bancaire


  • En favorisant, par la pédagogie de tes réponses, le quotidien des utilisateurs, et ainsi en contribuant à la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.


  • En participant à la mesure de la satisfaction des utilisateurs en contribuant à l’élaboration et au dépouillement d’enquêtes.


  • En favorisant l’autonomie des équipes de développement en Caisse Régionale en leur transmettant les bonnes pratiques.


  • En mettant à disposition des utilisateurs les outils d’aide à l’utilisation et à la fabrication : les outils de supervision.


  • En communiquant vers les utilisateurs sur les incidents ou les changements avec interruption de service de nos produits.


  • En participant aux cellules de résolution des incidents majeurs.



💡 D’être le garant du bon fonctionnement de nos plateformes (plateforme de fabrication et de consommation)



  • En facilitant la bonne appropriation des normes de développement auprès de l’ensemble des équipes de fabrication de CATS


  • En validant la performance des tableaux de bord avant leur mise à disposition



🔍 D’évoluer dans un environnement agile stimulant :



  • En t’appropriant les modèles de données des informations bancaires


  • En analysant les besoins métiers exprimés par les utilisateurs à travers les incidents ou les assistances


  • En t’alimentant de l’expertise de la squad, traduite au travers de bases de connaissance, arbres de décision…


  • En t’inspirant des retours d’expérience à l’occasion des cérémonies AGILE



💻Tu utiliseras toute la palette de tes compétences :


• En nourrissant ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement technique très large : Entrepôts de données sous SQL Server, TERADATA, Outils BI MicroSTrategy, BO Bi4


• Au quotidien, tu utiliseras SQL pour requêter et extraire des données pertinentes à partir de différentes sources de données pour pouvoir disposer des bons éléments.


• Notre environnement de travail est large et les interlocuteurs sont nombreux : Pôle Utilisateurs, autres squads Data & produits, référents CR… la communication et la pédagogie sont la clé !


• En évoluant dans un environnement Agile favorisant l’approche collective dans un cadre SCRUM



Ta Vie au sein de la SQUAD



✅ Une équipe axée sur le service client, la qualité et l’intelligence collective


🤝 Un esprit d’entraide et de collaboration


🤩 De la bonne humeur et des collègues passionnés et passionnants !


🧠 Une équipe pluridisciplinaire en termes de connaissances techniques


🌟 Un environnement de travail favorisant l’amélioration continue des process et des connaissances de l’équipe


🌟 Accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques


👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour t’aider à maximiser ton potentiel



Découvrez le site de Nantes.


𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :


Nous te proposons :

🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.


👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…


👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)


🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)



👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)


🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication


🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)


⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).



𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :


💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.


🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.


👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.


🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.


💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.


💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...


𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?


- Un premier échange avec ton Talent Acquisition Specialist Linda - 1h

- Un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un échange avec Jean-François, ton futur Leader ! - 1h


« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

Title: Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
ABOUT AXA




Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we’re always there for them. And we’re always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that’s open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that’s the real secret to success – and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.




Your work environment:




The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.




Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.




Data is a key part of AXA’s Strategic Plan “Unlock the Future” and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.




If you …

Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

…this position is made for you!







Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a “Data Portfolio Analyst” to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),…
Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,…) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,…) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,…) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views…) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management…)
Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events







Let’s talk about you:




Master’s degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
Around 3 to 5 years’ experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
Fluency in English, verbal and written
Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change







What we offer




You will join:




A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
A company with strong values
A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet




As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

Let’s talk about you:


  • Master’s degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
  • Around 3 to 5 years’ experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
  • Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
  • Fluency in English, verbal and written
  • Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
  • Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
  • Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
  • Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change



What we offer


You will join:


  • A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
  • A company with strong values
  • A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
  • A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
  • A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet


As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 65k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to €65k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con fuertes conocimientos en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de análisis de datos donde serás responsable de transformar datos complejos en insights claros y accionables mediante la creación y optimización de informes y dashboards en Power BI.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Optimizar modelos de datos en Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la eficiencia de los informes, asegurando tiempos de respuesta rápidos y uso eficiente de recursos.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

Mínimo 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Experiencia avanzada en Power BI, incluyendo la creación de informes y dashboards complejos.
Experiencia en la integración de Power BI con otras plataformas y sistemas empresariales.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas avanzadas.
Sólida experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como SQL, Python, o R.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst Junior Food Promotion (f/m)
Description:
Nel ruolo di Data Analyst Junior Food Promotion (f/m) lavorerai all’interno dell’Ufficio Acquisti in un team giovane e dinamico, potrai utilizzare le tue competenze analitiche ed entrare a far parte di un’azienda strutturata e in continua evoluzione.

Il tuo ruolo consisterà nel supporto analitico del reparto analizzando una serie di dati provenienti da fonti interne ed esterne, interpretandoli, evidenziandone i punti salienti e presentandoli in modo chiaro ed efficace agli interlocutori.

Se cerchi un lavoro stimolante che ti permetta di utilizzare e sviluppare al meglio le tue doti analitiche e statistiche questa è l’offerta giusta per te!







La posizione




La sede di lavoro sarà presso il nostro Headquarter di Arcole (VR).




Le principali mansioni per questa offerta di lavoro sono:

Preparazione di analisi statistiche e elaborazione di reportistica
Analisi ed interpretazione di tutte le informazioni relative ai dati per la valutazione dell’andamento dei processi di business, degli scostamenti dal budget e valutazioni a consuntivo
Supporto nella creazione, interpretazione e presentazione di reportistica agli stakeholder rilevanti, sia per l’Italia che per la casa madre tedesca
Analisi del mercato e monitoraggio della concorrenza
Sviluppo di soluzioni per l’ottimizzazione dei processi
Interfaccia operativa con i reparti interni e con la casa madre per il monitoraggio dei KPI di performance




Il profilo ricercato




I requisiti richiesti per ricoprire il ruolo di Data Analyst Junior Food Promotion sono:

Laurea con indirizzo economico /statistico o in ingegneria gestionale
Ottima padronanza di Excel e Powerpoint
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Preferibile conoscenza base della lingua tedesca
Forti skills analitiche e abilità di interpretare
Spiccate capacità di organizzazione e di lavoro in team
Flessibilità, precisione e autonomia lavorativa
Attitudine al problem solving




La nostra offerta




Cosa prevede l’offerta di lavoro per Data Analyst Junior Food Promotion (f/m)?

Un contratto di lavoro CCNL Commercio con livello commisurato all'esperienza maturata
Smart Working per una media di 2 giorni a settimana, cumulabili nel mese
Un processo annuale di Talent Management per sostenere il tuo sviluppo
Un percorso di inserimento completo e strutturato basato sul 'training on the job' e supportato dall'esperienza dei colleghi senior
Un ambiente di lavoro giovane, dinamico e stimolante certificato Top Employer
Un'azienda solida, strutturata, consapevole della propria responsabilità sociale e impegnata da anni con il consolidato programma di CSR 'Sulla via del domani'
Tante attività per coinvolgere i collaboratori e fare squadra anche fuori dal lavoro
Tanti vantaggi come il centro fitness gratuito, lavanderia convenzionata, 'Italiamo Lounge' per trascorrere piacevoli pause con i colleghi
Altri benefit previsti dal sistema di welfare Aziendale




Negli scorsi 30 anni la nostra crescita è stata sorprendente e non abbiamo intenzione di fermarci: in arrivo tanti nuovi store e nuove assunzioni. La prossima persona ad unirsi alla nostra squadra potresti essere TU!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
TA Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 5 anos experiência em Talend;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
MeJobby, agenzia per il lavoro 100% in cloud, con Autorizzazione Ministeriale n. 0000004.20-05-2021 cerca per importante società operante di Marketing e Comunicazione un/una Data Analyst.

Mansioni:

  • analisi di serie di dati e della loro accuratezza;
  • identificazione di modelli e tendenze;
  • presentazione dei risultati sotto forma di grafici analitici


Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Ingegneria o affini;
  • Esperienza di almeno 2 anni come Data Analyst;
  • Conoscenza di linguaggio Phyton oppure R;
  • Attitudine al lavoro in team ed attenzione ai dettagli


Orario di lavoro: full-time, dal lunedì al venerdì

Sede di lavoro: Milano

RAL commisurata all'esperienza del candidato

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad ambo i sessi.

I candidati possono inviare un CV con autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell'art. 13 d. lgs. 30 giugno 2003 n°196 - "Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali" e dell'art. 6* e 13 GDPR 679/16 - "Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali".

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of AON, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




About the role




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with visibility to real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company’s data model.




A typical day




Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through skillful data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal stakeholders.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various stakeholders that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.




What you need to succeed




About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.




About the recruitment process




Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the leaders from our amazing Data Analytics Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Analyst as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level on SQL and you will have a maximum of 4 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet




At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great office in Madrid, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)
Show more

  • Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.

  • Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.


About the recruitment process


  • Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
  • Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the leaders from our amazing Data Analytics Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Analyst as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
  • If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level on SQL and you will have a maximum of 4 days to complete it.
  • If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.


Why CoverWallet


At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure…


  • 💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
  • ⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
  • 🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
  • 📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
  • 🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
  • 🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
  • 🍏 Great office in Madrid, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
The Marketing department aims to encourage the world to be as enthusiastic about our products as we are. We have more than twenty different teams with specific areas of focus. Our teams are sharp, highly skilled, and data-driven, focusing on customer acquisition and monetization initiatives.

Main Responsibilities

  • Work mainly on SEO and Paid channels data;
  • Help to define and calculate KPIs and key metrics for the teams, monitor them in automated reports and dashboards;
  • Analyse users and product to find new business opportunities and areas for improvement;
  • Execute ad-hoc analyses;
  • Present insights to SEO, Paid teams;
  • Build, support and replicate data structures (including database structures, table building, reporting, data visualization, regression analysis, time series, etc.)




Core Requirements

  • Experience in e-commerce, SaaS or digital marketing environment;
  • Solid understanding and experience of SQL (Google BigQuery as an advantage) and Python or R (for data modeling and general development);
  • Strong communication skills, a proactive approach, analytical problem-solving abilities, and a collaborative mindset, being an effective and versatile team player;
  • Experience with Google Analytics;
  • Proven experience with various data visualization and statistical analysis methods;
  • Experience with a/b testing analysis is a plus




Salary Range


  • Gross Salary 2980-4300 EUR/Month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.

NordVPN is the world’s most advanced VPN service provider, used by millions of internet users worldwide. NordVPN provides double VPN encryption and Onion Over VPN and guarantees privacy with zero tracking. One of the key features of the product is Threat Protection, which blocks malicious websites, malware, trackers, and ads. NordVPN is very user friendly, offers one of the best prices on the market, and has over 5,000 servers in 59 countries worldwide.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, online and on-site workouts, consultations to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • More free time. Stay with us and additional vacation days will be added to your calendar;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




¿Quiénes somos?




K-LAGAN es una empresa internacional de servicios tecnológicos que se destaca por su compromiso con su equipo y la sociedad. Especializada en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, electrónica y proyectos de I+D, estamos buscando un/una Ingeniero de Datos con experiencia confirmada para unirse a nuestro equipo en el Departamento de Soluciones de Monitorización.




En esta posición tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades:




Construirás pipelines de datos utilizando PySpark.
Desarrollarás cubos tabulares con Analysis Services (DAX).
Crearás cuadros de mando utilizando Power BI.
Evaluarás necesidades para establecer una lista de requisitos funcionales y técnicos.
Trabajarás con equipos de terceros (equipo de integración de datos y equipo de Datalake).
Implementarás la ingesta y transformación de datos.




Lo que necesitas para destacarte en esta posición:




Experiencia de 4 a 7 años en las tecnologías y responsabilidades mencionadas.
Dominio de PySpark, Analysis Services (DAX), Power BI, Azure Datalake, Databricks, Azure Analysis Services y Azure DevOps.
Capacidad para diseñar soluciones técnicas que cubran las necesidades (Modelo de datos, Flujo de integración, Mapeo de datos).
Habilidades para trabajar de manera autónoma, siendo proactivo y dinámico.
Nivel de inglés alto ya que vas a trabajar con un equipo multicultural.




Al vincularte con K-LAGAN, estos serán tus beneficios:




Tendrás un contrato indefinido, mutua y proyecto estable.
Team building: barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos y encuentros para que estemos más cerca.
Seguimiento continuo: contarás con reuniones con nuestros BM para que sigas creciendo y puedas tener feedback sobre tu desempeño.
Acceso a formación adicional en tech skills, soft skills e idiomas.
Eventos especiales: cena de verano, cena de navidad y día solidario.
El día de tu cumpleaños será libre: ¡disfrútalo cómo, dónde y con quien quieras!




Los pasos de nuestro proceso de selección son:

Primera entrevista ; Entrevista Técnica ; Entrevista Final.




📍 Ubicación: Campo de las naciones (Madrid). Modalidad híbrida 2 días en oficina.




Si te apasiona la tecnología y tienes experiencia confirmada en el área, ¡te invitamos a unirte a nuestro equipo y crecer juntos en K-LAGAN! Aplica ahora.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For over a decade, the Bosch Cluj Plant has become a strategic hub for innovation and production, making a significant impact on the technological landscape in Romania. Through our constant commitment to excellence in quality and innovation, we develop a diverse range of modern products for the mobility industry, focusing on delivering cutting-edge solutions to our international customers. Inspired by passion for technology, we have consistently evolved, solidifying our position as the most desired employer in Cluj for the engineering and business candidates. We pay special attention to the development of our community, inspiring future generations and governing our impact on the environment.

Our promise to our colleagues is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and inspire each other. Join us and see the difference. Work



Job Description



Are you driven to unlock the power of data and translate it into strategic insights? Are you passionate about digital transformation? Our cutting-edge manufacturing plant is searching for a data whiz to join our team! As we embrace Industry 4.0 and become a data-driven powerhouse, you'll play a key role in crafting informative reports and dashboards using Tableau and PowerBI. We need someone who will understand our business inside and out, and can design and implement BI solutions that fuel smart decision-making. You'll be a data maestro, wrangling information from various sources like our ERP (SAP), MES, and data warehouse to paint a clear picture through KPIs.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable and insightful BI reports and dashboards using Tableau, PowerBI, and other relevant BI tools.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and define data requirements that align with business goals, ensuring accurate representation of data in BI reports.
Understand and analyze data from our ERP (SAP), MES, and various local solutions, integrating them effectively to provide comprehensive insights.
Continuously enhance data collection methods to improve efficiency and accuracy, supporting the creation of a robust data warehouse for KPI reporting.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, providing actionable insights to stakeholders.
Leverage low code / no code technologies to streamline data analytics processes and develop rapid prototypes of data solutions.
Implement low code / no code applications to enhance the flexibility and responsiveness of BI solutions to changing business needs.
Facilitate training and support for users of BI tools across the organization, fostering a data-driven culture.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst, with extensive experience in designing and implementing BI solutions.
Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and PowerBI is essential.
Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably SAP, MES, and data warehouse technologies.
Proficient in SQL and experience in querying databases, data manipulation, and analysis.
Familiarity with low code / no code platforms and their application in data analytics projects.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently.
Proactive, curious, and innovative, with a strong problem-solving aptitude.


Additional Information



Bosch Benefits

25 days of annual leave – because your work-life balance is essential to us
Annual performance bonus up to two salaries – we appreciate your contribution to the company’s success
Annual salary review – we want you to feel fairly compensated for your hard work and dedication
Gift tickets worth 300 RON for Christmas and Easter
Flexible benefits – you will benefit from a monthly benefit budget that offers the possibility to customize the benefits package to suit your individual needs and preferences (You can opt for meal tickets worth 30 RON for every worked day or you can benefit from cultural tickets, gift tickets, or vacation vouchers, and discounts at restaurants, dentistry, shops, and many more)
Referral bonus - we encourage you to refer new candidates and you will be rewarded for it
Relocation package – we are committed to providing a supportive and inclusive work environment, so if you are recruited from another county, you will receive a special relocation bonus for 2 years which will help you to get settled in Cluj
Lunch discount – we have two canteens within our plant where you can eat your lunch at subsidized price
Flexible working hours – so that you can balance you work and personal obligations more effectively
Ability to work from the satellite Bosch location in Cluj-Napoca when it’s more convenient for you to do so
Home Office policy – you will benefit from a hybrid working model which takes into consideration the needs of each department in the plant and offers you the possibility to work from home when it is practical and convenient for you
Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities
Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant

  • Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
  • Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities

Title: Junior Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We are Harbor Lab, a forward-thinking B2B software startup dedicated to fostering trust within the maritime ecosystem. Our vision is to revolutionize the way Shipping Companies and Port Agents conduct their operations, leveraging transparency and innovation to optimize the maritime industry's last mile. 

At Harbor Lab, we're committed to be the preferred partner for all maritime operations, driven by our core values of ambition, trustworthiness, genuine care for people, and agility. We bring value to both sides of the equation by streamlining processes, reducing costs, and facilitating well-informed decision-making. Our ultimate goal is to build trust in the maritime ecosystem and transform the way maritime businesses operate. 

Harbor Lab has also been recognized as one of the Best Workplaces in 2021 & 2022 & 2023 by the Great Place to Work Institute. 

About The Role

Data team is dedicated to provide innovative solutions and actionable insights that enable our company to stay ahead in a competitive market by harnessing the power of data to drive our business forward. As a member of the Data team, you will take on some of our biggest challenges and your work will impact the entire Harbor Lab experience. Our team moves very fast, so you'll have the opportunity to make an immediate difference! 

Are you fluent with Data? Do you pay attention to detail? Are you excited about joining a fast-pace, data-driven start-up environment?  

What You Will Be Doing


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate data findings to stakeholders
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to forecast future trends and business outcomes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements and provide analytical support. Work with the product team to help better understand the behaviour of our users, through usage and platform data, and find new ways to extract actionable intelligence from this data
Present insights and recommendations to senior management to support strategic planning and decision-making
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security in all analyses and reporting
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analytics tools, technologies, and best practices



Requirements

WE WOULD LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU IF YOU HAVE


Educational background in Physics, Maths, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative discipline or equivalent experience
Up to 2 years of hands-on experience in data modelling, reporting and predictive analytics to tackle business and user problems
Proficient in both SQL & Python
Experience with data visualization tools such as Quicksight, Tableau or Power BI
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Ability to interpret complex data and communicate findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Strong organizational and project management skills
Experience to measurement methodologies such as A/B, Pre/Post or Causal impact
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and best practices in data governance
Fulfilled military obligations (where applicable)



Additionally, The Following Will Be Considered a Plus


MSc / Ph.D. in relevant subjects
Understanding of ETL pipelines and working with APIs
Additional competence in data engineering, noSQL, Apache Hadoop, Spark
Knowledge of ML techniques such as Decision Trees, Regression, Clustering, Bayesian networks & LLMs



Benefits

WE OFFER


Attractive compensation package based on experience and skillset
30 days of paid annual leave
Private health insurance
Flexible working hours
Yoga classes & Life Coach Sessions


If you feel you can contribute to our goals and want to join an ambitious, shipping tech company with a unique culture, we would love to hear from you.


Harbor Lab is certified as Great Place to Work in Greece and is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws
Harbor Lab collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, you can contact us at people@harborlab.com
If you are applying to this job post, then we assume that you have the legal right to work in the EU

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analysts will be responsible for analyzing and problem solving as its relates to data, types of data, metadata, and relationships among data elements within a business system or IT system. This role interacts with end users and reporting analysts to understand key data entities and data structures in capturing detailed data requirements. They will identify correlations between raw enterprise data and management, so data extraction, analysis and transformations are used as actionable intelligence. Data analysts may receive requests from all members of the Bank including the management team and must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills. Data analysts will often assist in complex modeling to properly present data. Data analysts are responsible for consulting and assisting with project analysis, program design, report writing, scripting, dictionary synchronization, and other technical maters required for computer applications. Data analysts will create models and data sets that adhere to written standards and best practices, and fully test and document to assure expected results. The position requires strong data analysis, problem-solving, business process, time management, reporting skills and knowledge of R, SQL and/or Python.


Please note, this role requires the employee to be on site in Woburn, MA on a full time basis


Essential Functions

A data analyst with some experience is required, who has a strong background in client and team requirements gathering. The post holder will be part of the information strategy team.

Responsibilities will be expected to be developed and finalized over time and will include but will not be restricted to leading and carrying out:


Working under the supervision of the Data Management manager, partner with key business users and stakeholders to define data migration requirements, resolve data issues and validate procedures and results
Identify, document and validate data migration scope, data requirements and system/ infrastructure solutions
Define source system data requirements, data quality issues/fixes and business rules
Map and specify target data requirements and associated data transformations
Test data migration results and validate migration with key users and business analysts
Be a self-starter with solid interpersonal skills - projecting a very positive customer-service-oriented attitude
Adhere to processes and policies
Assist in the creation of dashboards for senior management
Develop automation or efficiencies in production and monitoring reports
Assist in creating and maintaining department procedures
Monitor and analyze the Bank’s business lines and provide reporting to senior management
Create insights from external datasets; market, industry, geographic and economic
Participate and enhance the current method of Bank reporting
Preparation of models for senior management
Ability to become proficient in the Bank’s CRM tool, Salesforce
Assist with document gathering for loan sales, participations and pledged assets
Participate in any current and future department goals
Assist supervisor on any ad hoc requests


JOB QUALIFICATIONS


Experience with mapping source to target systems with large data models
Strong SQL abilities for database query and reporting
Expert in Excel and proficient in other MS Office tools
Ability to understand and work with large quantities of data to identify trends, errors and gaps
Ability to multi-task and manage concurrent projects in various stages of development
Impeccable customer service and interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communications skills mandatory
Experience in customer management, contracts, product, pricing, invoicing and commissions preferred
Experience with ERP systems preferred
Experience with agile project management techniques preferred
Experience with data governance, master data management, data warehouse and business intelligence preferred


About Northern Bank & Trust Company

Northern Bank is a full-service bank dedicated to providing practical, common sense financial solutions to help our customers live their lives and grow their businesses. From deposit products to loans to payment and collections services, we work hands-on with our entrepreneurial customers, both locally and across the country, to provide the financial support they need to realize their personal and business goals. Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of over $3 billion with 13 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, and an Equal Housing Lender. For more information on online banking services, please visit www.NBTC.com or follow Northern Bank on Facebook (/NorthernBankM A/), Twitter (@northernbankma), Instagram (@northernbankma) and LinkedIn (company/northern-bank-ma/).

Data Analysts will be responsible for analyzing and problem solving as its relates to data, types of data, metadata, and relationships among data elements within a business system or IT system. This role interacts with end users and reporting analysts to understand key data entities and data structures in capturing detailed data requirements. They will identify correlations between raw enterprise data and management, so data extraction, analysis and transformations are used as actionable intelligence. Data analysts may receive requests from all members of the Bank including the management team and must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills. Data analysts will often assist in complex modeling to properly present data. Data analysts are responsible for consulting and assisting with project analysis, program design, report writing, scripting, dictionary synchronization, and other technical maters required for computer applications. Data analysts will create models and data sets that adhere to written standards and best practices, and fully test and document to assure expected results. The position requires strong data analysis, problem-solving, business process, time management, reporting skills and knowledge of R, SQL and/or Python.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THE ROLE

As a Data Analyst at Sofar, you’ll be a data partner with leaders across the business. You’ll build dashboards that provide crucial insights into business performance, create reports and run analyses that uncover stories about where our efforts are having the most impact, and help us understand key levers to unlock future growth.

We have a considerably large pool of data, so you’ll help keep everything clean and digestible, working with engineering to make sure we’re ingesting and structuring data in sustainable ways.

Because the work is critical for our company, we’re looking for someone who truly understands how to use data to influence business strategy. You’ll be a driving force behind our growth and help our team do what we do best – putting on incredible concerts around the world.




What you’ll do:
You’ll build dashboards that give key department leaders insight into business performance and levers we can pull to drive growth
You’ll run analyses and tell actionable stories with data, extracting key points and sharing complex learnings in easy-to-digest ways
You’ll partner with folks across the business to help us better understand supply and demand, providing insight into the relationship between inventory, sales projections, user retention
You’ll expose the interaction between marketing channels and traffic sources, including but not limited to email, search, social media, and bespoke local city promotional efforts
You’ll help publish data in easy to consume, understandable ways that allow stakeholders to self-service some of their data needs
You’ll be a champion of our analytic abilities, while ensuring accurate and ethical use of data





Who you are:
You have 4+ years of experience as an in-house Analyst (across Data, Growth, Business Intelligence, Marketing, etc.) at a high growth e-commerce B2C company
You know how to effectively collaborate with teams and stakeholders to determine best approaches to measurement
You have a track record of generating plausible hypotheses on business drivers and validating them with data
You have strong knowledge of SQL – bonus points for Redshift, BigQuery, or Postgres, and analytics-focused platforms like Jupyter or R-Studio
You have experience with Metabase, Looker, PowerBI, or other common data visualization tools
You understand supply and demand modeling and forecasting
You are eligible for employment in the US, preferably within 2 hours of the East Coast time zone
Most importantly: you have a passion for growth, are naturally curious, and know how to get things done!
